title: Senior Bookkeeper with Australian Company Experience
description:
Senior Bookkeeper 

Company: Workwise Auto Solutions

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Hours: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM PH Time, Monday to Friday

Hourly Rate: $10-$12 AUD



About Us

Workwise Auto Solutions partners with Australian mechanical workshops to streamline their bookkeeping, systems, and operations. We provide accurate, efficient, and connected bookkeeping support that keeps our clients’ businesses running smoothly.

We’re growing and looking for an experienced Work From Home Bookkeeper who thrives in a fast-paced environment, works well under pressure, and takes pride in delivering accurate results on time, every time.



The Role

We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Bookkeeper for an immediate start in a full-time, remote position supporting our Australian clients.

This role supports Australian small and medium trade businesses and requires someone who can confidently manage the full bookkeeping function without supervision.

This is not an entry-level position and is not trainable. You must be able to step into the role from day one with no hand-holding.



Non-Negotiable Requirements

You must have:

- 100% proficiency in Xero (senior-level capability is mandatory)

- Demonstrated experience in full-cycle bookkeeping using Australian standards

- Strong understanding of Australian tax compliance and bookkeeping obligations

- Hands-on experience with bank and clearing account reconciliations

- Payroll experience including STP Phase 2 compliance (essential)

- Solid understanding of superannuation and PAYG obligations

- Ability to complete month-end procedures and reporting independently

- Proven experience supporting Australian trade businesses (essential)

- Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines

- Close attention to detail, accuracy, and speed

- Strong tech-savviness and ability to learn systems quickly

- Ability to follow established processes exactly

- Excellent English (written and spoken) with a friendly, professional demeanor

- Dual computer screens and a stable, high-speed internet connection



Preferred / Added Advantage

While not essential, you will stand out if you have:

- Experience with Stripe and/or Pinch integrations with Xero

- Experience with software integrations linking sales/payment systems into Xero

- Strong familiarity with mechanical workshops or automotive industry workflows



Who We’re Looking For

- Takes full ownership of the bookkeeping function

- Works efficiently while maintaining complete accuracy

- Requires no training or supervision

- Thrives in a structured, process-driven environment

- Is proactive, solutions-focused, and reliable



Junior, partially trained, or general VA profiles are not suitable for this role.



What We Offer

- Full-time, long-term remote role (Work From Home)

- Opportunity to work with an established Australian team

- Supportive, friendly, and collaborative environment

- Room for growth as our company expands



How to Apply

If you meet all non-negotiable requirements and are ready to step into a senior role immediately, we want to hear from you.



Please note:

Applications submitted via
 or directly through this job post will not be considered.

We are strictly reviewing applications submitted through the following form:


/xjG3BZHaGHLgVrjWe2F8 



Important:

Confirmation that you meet the non-negotiable requirements (Please note that unless you meet the non-negotiable job role, our system will automatically filter you out, so please ONLY apply if you have the required senior-level experience.

You will be responsible for gathering and processing customer orders accurately and efficiently. This includes coordinating with third-party logistics (3PL) providers for inbound and outbound shipments to ensure smooth operations.

2. Product listing and scheduling

As a distributor of K-POP records and merchandise, you will be involved in registering new products into our system. This includes managing inventory, updating product information, and ensuring accurate data entry. Additionally, you will be responsible for scheduling release dates and managing timelines using tools like Google Calendar.

3. Sales & Marketing

You will be responsible for studying and trying how to gain traffics to our shopping mall. Active working on research articles related to SEO, social marketing and finding where and how to promote our shopping mall is required.

4. Customer service support

providing excellent customer service is crucial to us. You will be responsible for addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction. Your communication skills and problem-solving abilities will play a vital role in maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers.



[Required qualifications & skillset (must have)]

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience in puchasing K-POP Album or knowledge of K-POP related products (album, merchandise)

* Idea of how to promote K-POP albums and gain traffics in our shopping mall in PH online K-POP community for each artists



[Desired qualifications & skillset (nice to have)]

* Experience in handling customer service

* Experience in Photoshop

* Experience in
 Ads or Google Ads

* Knowledge and Experience of Microsoft Excel & Familar with Using Various Formula

* Experience in experience in Amazon Business (Familiar with Interface and function) or other E-commerce Platform



[Compensation & Employment Terms]

* ONLY Looking for a full time employee

* $300~$400/mo. determined based on the candidate’s skills, experience, and overall evaluation relative to other applicants

* One-year renewable Contract

- Compensation and terms may be adjusted based on attendance, teamwork, and performance.

- Exceptional performers may be considered for early renewal or adjustment. (multiple successful cases)

* 6-month probationary period with possibility of early conversion to regular position based on performance (multiple successful cases)



[Perks & Benefits]

1. Regular Employee Benefits

- 13th Month Salary provided

- 10 additional paid leave days upon regularization

2. Birthday Benefit (After 6 Months of Employment)

- Receive one free K-POP album of your favorite artist on your birthday

3. Paid Holidays (Regardless of Employment Status)

- January 1st (New Year’s Day) and Christmas Day are paid holidays

- Applies to both probationary and regular employees

4. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

5. Long Service Incentive Program

- 1-Year Service / 3-Year Service / 5-Year Service

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form






Interview via google meet will be conducted after first screening and candidates will be notifed to their
s or
 



Thank you

title: Social Media Agent
description:
Only apply after reading completely:



I’m looking to add a new member to my team. This person will be responsible for creating template-based thumbnails and filling in video details for our channel.



You will be given a fixed workload per week and must meet a daily quota. You are expected to work 5 days per week, but you are free to manage your time as long as the work is delivered on schedule. You will need to work with 30 listings per day.



Experience / Knowledge Required:



Canva



Basic design skills



YouTube (channel management)



Strong English grammar



Creative and detail-oriented



There are 2 steps in the selection process:



1. Demo Task:

A small group of candidates will receive a document with instructions for a short demo. In this demo, you will showcase your skills by completing a few short tasks (approximately 15 minutes).



2. Interview & Trial:

3 to 4 candidates will be shortlisted and invited to participate in a one-week test period.



This position is for a 2-year contract.

title: Graphic Designer who #Believes in Entrepreneurs| Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We're trying to solve the world's biggest problem: People don't #Believe in themselves enough. For over 22 years, Evan Carmichael has been dedicated to this mission. The way we're approaching this problem is producing inspirational content at scale. The right video at the right time can completely change someone's life and we want to touch as many lives as possible. People may not have a supportive family or community around them, but our content can help give them the belief they need to chase their dreams and make the world a better place. We want to work with people who also want to make an impact and touch people's lives. In your application, please put ‘I am your next awesome Graphic Designer’ in the subject line. Please apply through OnlineJobsPh and not via
. The job responsibilities include designing and creating engaging YouTube thumbnails, researching trending thumbnail styles, editing and enhancing images, organizing and maintaining a thumbnail archive, analyzing thumbnail performance, collaborating with the content team, ensuring brand consistency, and assisting with basic design tasks. Additionally, creativity, attention to detail, and collaboration skills are key to creating thumbnails that align with the brand and content strategy. Please also share the link to your resume and portfolio, what your hourly salary expectations are, and in the first line of your message tell us how many YouTube subscribers Evan Carmichael has, followed by who your favorite entrepreneur of all time is and why. Please make sure to send your job application here on OnlineJobs and not via
. The job is full time (40 hours per week) with a flexible schedule. We would start off with a small project for now and we'd pay you for your ideas and research. We also like to work with people over a long period of time, not just short contracts, and give them opportunities to succeed and do more based on what they want to learn. Hopefully that will be you! Thank you for reading and good luck! Sending lots of love! Irish #Believe

title: World's Greatest VA for the World's Greatest Salsa School
description: We are Toronto Dance Salsa, Canada’s largest Salsa dance school. Our vision is to solve the world’s greatest problem: lonliness. For over 10 years, we’ve been building a community where people feel they belong. We believe in creating a tribe you choose, not just the family you’re born into. Do you want to help make this vision real? If you’re eagre to do purposeful work and grow both professionally and personally, you may have found your new HOME. This isn’t just a job, it’s an opportunity to learn how to make an impact. In your application, please put “I am your next awesome Virtual Assistant!” in the subject line. The job responsibilities include administrative and techincal support, answering emails from students and making them feel welcomed, managing logistics and staying organized, and being proactive in improving role efficiency and suggesting business improvements. The ideal candidate is detail oriented, has excellent English skills, technical proficiency, customer support experience, and reliable equipment. Please also include the link to your resume, your hourly salary expectations, your ideal work schedule, and in the first line of your message list any spelling or grammatical errors you found in this job post. We have to change one of our weekly classes, so please calculate the new Sunday schedule for a 6 week course by moving the start date later by 3 weeks. Current 2024 schedule: June 9 to July 21, with no class on June 30. Rules: we do not run classes on Ontario statutory holidays, and if a holiday lands on a Friday or Monday, we take that whole weekend off. In your application, include the full list of the 6 new Sunday class dates in order, and please watch this Loom video: https://www.loom.com/share/c94f31deec134ebfbac63432c40ab47c (irishcaipangtds@gmail.com). The job is full time (40 hours per week) with the opportunity to transition into a long term role, would start immediately, and is ongoing. We would start with a small project first, and we’d pay you for your ideas and research. Be part of a team that’s changing people’s lives. Thank you for considering joining our mission to solve lonliness. We look forward to possibly having you feel like you belong at our school as well. Please submit your job application only via OnlineJobs.ph. Do not send your application message. Irish #Belong

title: Sales Representative
description:
Join a fast-growing US online home goods retailer and enjoy the learning and opportunities that you have while working with us.



We strive to provide 5-star service & shopping assistance to all of our clients, and all of our team is accountable to fulfill this.



We are looking for a Sales Representative who can assist prospective buyers and close online ecommerce sales.



We're only looking for full-time, long-term, ongoing cooperation.



Work schedules available:

8 AM to 4 PM US EST

4 PM to 12 AM US EST



Your work week will be 5 days per week, with 2 days off per week. Days off will be selected with your manager. We will try to accommodate your preferences for which days you like, based on availability.



This role starts ASAP!!



Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and sends text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them



Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in sales on the phone

Experience must include both inbound and outbound sales

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Experience in Customer Service on the phone is a nice to have

Experience in the e-commerce (online shopping) industry is nice to have

Home improvement, construction, and gas plumbing industry experience is a plus

Outgoing, friendly, and lively

Can-do mindset, with a sense of ownership, pride in your performance, and its impact on the company’s success

Long-term commitment - treat this as your career



What we can offer:

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping costs. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position

title: LawMatics Data Migration Specialist (Legal Industry Experience Required)
description:
Immediate Deliverable (Primary Project)

Data Migration & Validation Project: August 2025 - Present



Migrate ALL lead/client data from Google Sheets into LawMatics

Cross-reference and merge entries already in LawMatics

Validate data accuracy (correct dates, sources, contact info, case status)

Flag incomplete or questionable data for review

Establish LawMatics as the single source of truth going forward

Timeline Expectation: This should be completed within 2-4 weeks depending on data volume.



Non-Negotiable Requirements

Technical Requirements (Must Have Day 1):

Proven LawMatics experience - not "willing to learn," must have used it professionally 

Advanced Google Sheets skills - VLOOKUP, data validation, conditional formatting, pivot tables 

Data cleaning expertise - deduplication, standardization, error identification 

CRM data migration experience - has done this type of project before 

Excel/Sheets data manipulation - importing, exporting, formatting for CRM upload



Work Requirements:

Self-directed - can work independently without hand-holding 

Quality-obsessed - will verify their own work before submitting 

Process documentation - can create SOPs for ongoing data maintenance 

Reliable internet & work setup - professional home office environment 

Availability during US business hours (at least partial overlap for questions)



Screening Questions for Candidates

LawMatics-Specific:

"How many LawMatics implementations or data migrations have you completed?"

"Explain how you would prevent duplicate contacts when importing leads into LawMatics."

"What LawMatics reports have you built before?"

"Describe your process for cleaning a messy spreadsheet with 500+ leads before importing to a CRM."

"How do you verify data accuracy after migration?"

"Share an example where you caught a data discrepancy that would have caused problems."



Requirements:



Minimum 1 year hands-on experience with LawMatics CRM (must provide examples)

Proven track record of CRM data migration projects (300+ records)

Advanced Google Sheets/Excel skills (formulas, data cleaning, imports/exports)

Experience working with US-based law firms preferred

Must work independently with minimal supervision

Available for at least 4 hours overlap with US Eastern time

Project Scope: Migrate 6 months of lead data from Google Sheets into LawMatics with 100?curacy. Deduplicate existing records, validate all fields, and establish LawMatics as our single source of truth.



To Apply:



Describe your most recent LawMatics data migration project

Explain your process for ensuring data accuracy

Provide 2 references from US law firms (if available)

Confirm your hourly rate and availability

This is a PROJECT-BASED role with potential for ongoing data maintenance.

Give examples of data scrubbing projects

description:
!We’re Hiring: Logistics Coordinator (English + Mandarin is a Plus)



We are looking for an experienced Logistics & Production Coordinator to manage end-to-end logistics and production operations across factories, 3PL partners, and wholesale and DTC channels. This role will work closely with China-based factories, global warehouses, and B2B clients to ensure smooth production flow, accurate inventory management, and on-time delivery across regions.



Job Description



The Logistics & Production Coordinator will oversee sample and bulk production shipments, coordinate inbound and outbound logistics with 3PL partners, track daily shipment status, and manage inventory check-ins from factories. Responsibilities include preparing packing lists and shipping documentation, supporting EDI compliance for U.S. wholesale and department store accounts, coordinating landed shipments in the U.S. and Europe, and maintaining clear communication with internal teams, warehouses, and clients. The role also involves sourcing trims and shipping materials from Asia, tracking manufacturing timelines, enforcing production deadlines, and resolving logistics issues under tight timelines.



Qualifications



- 3–5 years of experience in logistics, production coordination, supply chain, or 3PL operations

- Hands-on experience working with China-based factories and international suppliers

- Strong understanding of inbound/outbound logistics, inventory management, and shipping documentation

- Experience with 3PL systems; EDI compliance experience is a strong plus

- Ability to manage multiple timelines, stakeholders, and shipments simultaneously

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

- Fluency in English and Mandarin (spoken and written) is required

- Comfortable communicating with factories and partners via
, WeChat, and other tools



Application Process



 Step 1: Complete our online assessment questionnaire (required)

 Step 2: Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for initial interview

 Step 3: Final candidates will be contacted for final interview



Please note: Applications without a completed questionnaire will not be reviewed.



Link for questionnaire:

title: LawMatics Data Migration Specialist (Legal Industry Experience Required)
description:
Immediate Deliverable (Primary Project)

Data Migration & Validation Project: August 2025 - Present



Migrate ALL lead/client data from Google Sheets into LawMatics

Cross-reference and merge entries already in LawMatics

Validate data accuracy (correct dates, sources, contact info, case status)

Flag incomplete or questionable data for review

Establish LawMatics as the single source of truth going forward

Timeline Expectation: This should be completed within 2-4 weeks depending on data volume.



Non-Negotiable Requirements

Technical Requirements (Must Have Day 1):

Proven LawMatics experience - not "willing to learn," must have used it professionally

Advanced Google Sheets skills - VLOOKUP, data validation, conditional formatting, pivot tables

Data cleaning expertise - deduplication, standardization, error identification

CRM data migration experience - has done this type of project before

Excel/Sheets data manipulation - importing, exporting, formatting for CRM upload



Work Requirements:

Self-directed - can work independently without hand-holding

Quality-obsessed - will verify their own work before submitting

Process documentation - can create SOPs for ongoing data maintenance

Reliable internet & work setup - professional home office environment

Availability during US business hours (at least partial overlap for questions)



Screening Questions for Candidates

LawMatics-Specific:

"How many LawMatics implementations or data migrations have you completed?"

"Explain how you would prevent duplicate contacts when importing leads into LawMatics."

"What LawMatics reports have you built before?"

"Describe your process for cleaning a messy spreadsheet with 500+ leads before importing to a CRM."

"How do you verify data accuracy after migration?"

"Share an example where you caught a data discrepancy that would have caused problems."



Requirements:



Minimum 1 year hands-on experience with LawMatics CRM (must provide examples)

Proven track record of CRM data migration projects (300+ records)

Advanced Google Sheets/Excel skills (formulas, data cleaning, imports/exports)

Experience working with US-based law firms preferred

Must work independently with minimal supervision

Available for at least 4 hours overlap with US Eastern time

Project Scope: Migrate 6 months of lead data from Google Sheets into LawMatics with 100?curacy. Deduplicate existing records, validate all fields, and establish LawMatics as our single source of truth.



To Apply:



Describe your most recent LawMatics data migration project

Explain your process for ensuring data accuracy

Provide 2 references from US law firms (if available)

Confirm your hourly rate and availability

This is a PROJECT-BASED role with potential for ongoing data maintenance.

Give examples of data scrubbing projects

title: Senior Accountant / Financial Manager
description:
Must be available for immediate start. Please do not apply unless you have at least 5 years experience in accounting roles. It is ideal if you have worked with project or construction businesses in Australia. 



About us

Raven Tanks designs, builds, and services engineered water storage across Australia for fire, potable, industrial, and process applications. We are growing and need a switched on accounts operator who owns WIP, invoicing, and compliance. 



Key responsibilities

• Prepare WIP reports for all open jobs at cutoff dates

• Track costs to date and invoices to date per job and reconcile to WIP

• Raise client invoices on time and follow up overdue accounts

• Manage payables and receivables and keep Xero tidy and up to date

• Support QBCC and audit requests and maintain clean job files

• Lodge BAS and keep GST, PAYG, super, and tax obligations on time

• Provide weekly cashflow and aged receivables updates

• Work with project managers to capture all costs and variations

• Maintain tidy records and proof for every figure you submit



Must have

• Experience in accounts or bookkeeping in a jobs based or construction environment

• Hands on WIP understanding using costs to date and invoices to date

• Xero experience

• Strong Excel and attention to detail

• Clear written and verbal communication and a proactive follow up mindset



Nice to have

• Experience with QBCC reporting

• Experience with job cost modules or project accounting tools

• Understanding of Australian payroll basics and super



What you get

• Stable role in a growing engineering business

• Real ownership over the numbers and processes

• Competitive salary based on experience 

Starting salary 1600 USD / MONTH but potentially more for right candidate. 



How to apply

Do not apply here. Send resume AND a 1 minute video to Matt on WhatsApp at 
explaining why you are suited to this role.

title: eCommerce Sales Support
description:

- Proactively follow up with new trade-in customers to boost conversion rates.

Tools We Use

- Slack

- Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Gmail)

- eBay (messaging, disputes, customer support)

- Shippo & ShipStation (inbound & outbound shipping)



Requirements

- 2+ Years in eCommerce inbound sales or support 
 + chat)

- Proven experience with Gmail and the Google Suite

- Excellent written English (must be clear, professional, and persuasive)

- Reliable setup: stable internet, sufficiently powerful computer/laptop, backup plan for outages.



Nice to Have

Work Schedule & Pay

- Must overlap with majority US business hours for customer response times (example: 9:00am–5:00pm US Central is is 10:00pm–6:00am PH [CDT, Mar–Nov] or 11:00pm–7:00am PH [CST, Nov–Mar]).

Qualities of our culture

- Communicativeness: timely responses to both our customers and other tea
mbers is esssential.

mbers.

- Positivity: Being highly engaged and excited for customers, tea
mbers, and the impact we are making is a must.



To apply, please answer the following in your application, and mention the contact person's name followed by "hello world" in the first sentence of your response. (applications without answers will not be considered):



1. Describe your experience with WooCommerce and eBay Seller Hub. What tasks have you handled?

2. Which of our listed tools do you already have hands-on experience with?

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
IMPORTANT: If you are interested and qualified, please submit a link to your resume AND your voice recording to 
 will only process applications of those who will send both. Applications sent through OLJ will be automatically discarded. DO NOT apply if you do not have the experience.



Senior Full Stack Developer (Distributed Systems &

Computational Modeling)



Role Overview: We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our core

engineering team building a proprietary platform for high-stakes industrial simulations and

capital project optimization. You will be responsible for developing the underlying

framework that manages complex, multi-stage computational pipelines. Your work will

focus on the seamless integration of heavy backend processing with a responsive, datarich

user experience, ensuring the reliable execution of sophisticated resource and design

optimizations.



Technical Requirements

1. Backend & Distributed Systems (Python Core):

• High-Performance Python: Advanced proficiency in Python, specifically utilizing

numerical and scientific libraries for large-scale data manipulation and algorithmic

optimization.

• Asynchronous Architecture: Extensive experience with distributed task queues

(e.g., Celery) to manage long-running, interdependent background processes and

complex workflow signatures.

• Algorithmic Implementation: Strong background in applied mathematics,

including spatial geometry, graph theory, and network flow optimization.

• Data Lifecycle Management: Expertise in managing state across distributed

systems using high-performance caching layers and persistent databases.



2. API & Real-Time Infrastructure:

• Framework Mastery: Deep experience with Python-based web frameworks (e.g.,

Django) for building robust, secure, and scalable API architectures.

• Real-Time Data Streaming: Proficiency in implementing WebSockets or similar

protocols to provide live telemetry and status updates from background engines to

the end-user.

• System Integrity: Experience designing systems that maintain strict data

consistency across multi-step, automated computational workflows.



3. Frontend & Visualization:

• Data-Intensive UIs: Ability to build sophisticated interfaces for managing complex

input parameters and visualizing multi-variable simulation outputs.

• Spatial Visualization: Experience rendering and manipulating 3D geometric entities

(vertices, faces, and polylines) within the browser to provide visual validation of

backend calculations.





Key Responsibilities:

• Bridge the gap between high-level logical planning and low-level computational

execution.

• Optimize the performance of proprietary spatial and geometric algorithms.

• Build the infrastructure that allows users to audit and interact with complex,

automated engineering decisions in real-time.

• Maintain and scale a distributed environment where background tasks must operate

with high reliability and low latency.





Preferred Qualifications:

• Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or a related

Engineering field.

• Proven track record of building "Human-in-the-loop" systems where users interact

with complex automated processes.

• Prior experience in fields such as industrial automation, logistics, CAD software

development, or advanced manufacturing simulations.

• Familiarity with mining/energy industries is a plus.

title: AMAZON OPERATION/ACCOUNT MANAGER
description:
AMAZON OPERATION MANAGER



Position: Amazon Operations Manager / Amazon Expert

Type: Full-Time, Hybrid (Philippines)

Salary: PHP 45,000 – 75,000 / month

Schedule: Flexible Hybrid daytime PH hours



About our Company



We are a Canadian corporation specialized in international trade and e-commerce. We are operating in the global market, and we want to utilize global ecommerce platforms such as Amazon to develop new brands and products and reach out to customers across globe. Our company values professionalism, data-driven decision-making, and long-term partnerships. We are establishing a strong, world-class team in the Philippines.

We're seeking an Amazon Operation Manager who will implement effective growth strategies, help managing day-to-day operations, hiring staff and ensure optimal ROAS (Return on Ad Spend) and profitability.



Role Summary



As the Amazon Operation Manager, you will oversee one or more Amazon seller/vendor accounts, be responsible for strategic planning, day-to-day operations, campaign management, listing optimization, inventory & health monitoring, performance reporting and delivering growth targets. You’ll assist in hiring a Manila based team (PPC specialists, graphic designers, copy/content, operations, data analysts) as contractors or part-time staff.



Key Responsibilities



- Own the Amazon account(s): day-to-day operations, growth roadmap, strategic planning.

- Develop and execute account growth strategy: new product launches, listing optimization (titles, bullets, A+ content), SEO/organic traffic, sponsored ads (Sponsored Products/Brands/Display), DSP where applicable.

- Assist in hiring new tea
mbers in coordination with the owners: you will be the point of contact for the company for the Manila team and will assist in hiring part-time or full-time staff/contractors, freelancers to complete the tasks based on demand.

- Manage other tea
mbers and monitor KPIs: manage and monitor other tea
mbers and coordinate their efforts to achieve the desired outcomes. creative team for imagery/video, buyer for product research, procurement, and inventory planning, PPC specialist for running and optimizing variety of ads campaigns.

- Plan, run, and optimize PPC campaigns in coordination with the PPC specialist: structure, keyword research, match types, negative keyword strategy, bid optimization, budget allocation, ROI/ROAS modelling.

- Monitor and optimize key performance metrics: ACoS (Advertising Cost of Sales), TACoS (Total Advertising Cost of Sales), ROAS, ad conversion rate, organic sales lift, margin impact.

- Provide detailed reports and insights to: weekly/monthly performance review, actionable recommendations, forecast next period.

- Stay up to date with Amazon policy changes, ad product updates, algorithm changes, marketplace shifts and emerging best practices.

- Identify scaling opportunities while ensuring profitability: when to scale spend, when to pull back, how to optimize conversion vs traffic.

- Serve as an account leader for the company: manage expectations, communicate clearly, act proactively on issues (listing suppressions, account health, negative reviews).

- Work with automation/data tools and dashboards: pull/clean data, identify waste/spend inefficiencies, drive process improvement (e.g., by leveraging no-code automations, data pipelines).



Qualifications



- 2+ years of experience managing Amazon seller or vendor accounts (or equivalent e-commerce marketplace experience).

- Strong understanding of Amazon advertising ecosystem: Sponsored Products/Brands/Display, DSP, auto vs manual campaigns, bidding strategies, search term reports.

- Proven ability to improve ROAS/ACoS and profitability for Amazon accounts.

- Excellent analytical skills: ability to interpret data, create actionable insights, optimize campaigns based on performance.

- Experience with Amazon listing optimization: keyword research, SEO, copywriting (titles/bullets/A+), conversion-rate focus.

- Familiarity with Amazon account health, operations, inventory forecasting, and marketplace best practices.

- Comfortable being company-facing: strong communication, presentation skills, managing expectations, building trust. You will be communicating directly with the owners of the company.

- Self-starter, organized, able to manage multiple brands, accounts and projects concurrently.

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; experience with dashboards / BI tools a plus.

- Bonus: experience with automation tools, no-code platforms, AI-driven optimization (a growing focus).



KPIs / Success Measures



- Achieving or exceeding client ROAS/ACoS targets.

- Improvement in organic sales and overall account profitability.

- Reduction in wasted ad spending (negative keywords, inefficient campaigns).

- Client satisfaction and retention (renewals, upsells).

- Timely reporting and proactive account strategy updates.

- Efficient cross-team collaboration and issue resolution (listing suppressions, inventory, reviews, etc.).



What We Offer



- Working directly for a Canadian company with global opportunities

- Collaborative, high-performance environment.

- Competitive salary + performance bonus (tied to KPIs).

- Professional growth path: potentially moving into higher roles and moving to other countries.

- Hybrid opportunity (Mandaluyong City and remotely)

title: Lead Generation + Community Outreach Virtual Assistant (Martial Arts)
description:
About the Business



We run martial arts training with two formats:

In-person classes at William Fasulo Park, Florida City, FL — Saturday & Sunday, 10:00 AM–12:00 PM ET

Online classes — Monday–Thursday, 7:00–8:00 PM ET



Goal: Get more students by actively finding and contacting interested people, and organizing leads for follow-up.



IMPORTANT CONSTRAINTS (Read Carefully)



You WILL post in social media groups 
 groups, community forums, etc.) using approved content.

You will NOT have access to my personal social media accounts.

Quo will be used for texting (you will send/receive SMS through Quo as part of outreach and follow-up).

Any direct outreach must follow group rules/platform policies.

If someone says “stop,” “unsubscribe,” “don’t contact,” etc., we do not contact again.



Weekly Performance Goals



50 new leads/week added to HubSpot (tagged correctly)

Suggested mix: 25 local / 25 online, but adjust based on what’s working

30 leads/week contacted (DM, text via Quo,
, etc.)

10 engaged replies/week (they respond with interest/questions)

3 booked intros/week (intro session scheduled)

(Note: “Paid” conversions are tracked by the manager, not you — your role is generating and progressing leads.)



Your Main Responsibilities



A) Lead Sourcing (Active Approach — Not Just Posting)



Find prospects in:

Local (Florida City / Homestead / South Dade)

Online (nationwide, evening availability)



Where you find them: community/parent groups, fitness/self-defense/martial arts groups, public org contact lists, event calendars, and other approved channels.



Deliverable: Leads entered into HubSpot with full tracking fields (see below).



B) Group Posting (Approved Content Only)



Post in relevant groups (follow rules), and keep a log: group name, link, date, post text.



C) Direct Outreach (DM + Texting via Quo)



Beyond posting, do direct contact where allowed:



DM people who comment/engage (where permitted)

Contact group admins to request approval

Reach out to community orgs using public contact info

Text leads using Quo for follow-up and booking (using approved scripts)



D) Lead Management + Follow-Up (HubSpot)



Log every lead and every touch in HubSpot so attribution is clean.



HubSpot Tracking Rules:

1) Every lead must be created in HubSpot



Required fields on every lead:



Lead Source: FB Group Post, FB Group DM, Quo Text, Community Org Outreach, Referral, Flyer/Poster, Online Inquiry, Other

Campaign: e.g., Feb 2026 – In-Person Florida City or Feb 2026 – Online

Origin: exact group/org name

VA Name: your name

Interest Type: In-person / Online / Both

Status/Stage: (see below)

Last Touch Date + Next Follow-Up Date



2) Pipeline Stages



New Lead (Not Contacted)

Contacted

Engaged (Replied / Interested)

Booked Intro

Showed Up (Manager updates this)

Paid (Manager updates this)

Not Interested

DNC (Do Not Contact)



3) Conversion + Bonus Tracking (How you’ll be credited) ($10 Bonus per converted lead)



You do NOT d
 whether someone converted.

Only the manager updates Showed Up and Paid.

Bonuses are calculated weekly from HubSpot using Paid leads where VA Name = your name.

Your job is to ensure leads are logged correctly so you get proper credit.



Approved Outreach Scripts



In-person (Local):

“Hi! I help coordinate a martial arts class in Florida City. We train at William Fasulo Park Sat & Sun 10–12. Want the details or to try a first session?”

Online:

“Hi! We offer online martial arts classes Mon–Thu 7–8pm ET. Want details on joining a beginner-friendly intro class?”

Follow-up:

“Just checking in—do you want me to send the class details? If not, no worries.”

Opt-out:

“If you’d rather not receive messages, just tell me ‘stop’ and I won’t message again.”



Compensation



$100/month

Optional bonus per conversion (tracked in HubSpot as described)



To Apply



Reply with:



Your lead gen/community outreach experience

HubSpot/Quo or CRM experience

English writing level (Spanish is a plus)

Hours/week you can commit

title: Sales-Focused Virtual Assistant (Strong Closer with Admin Skills) – U.S. Cleaning Business
description:
We are hiring a Sales-Oriented Virtual Assistant who knows how to confidently handle objections and close deals over the phone. You’ll be the first point of contact for leads interested in our U.S.-based cleaning services, and your main goal is to convert those inquiries into paying customers.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in sales conversations, knows how to build trust quickly, and doesn’t shy away from tough questions or hesitations from prospects.

Key Responsibilities:

Take inbound sales calls from interested leads and follow up with outbound calls when needed





Confidently pitch our services and walk customers through pricing and packages





Handle common objections (pricing, scheduling, trust concerns) with professionalism and ease





Convert warm leads into scheduled jobs with a consistent close rate





Manage CRM updates, lead tracking, and post-call notes





Assist with scheduling, follow-up
s, and basic administrative tasks





Maintain excellent customer service before, during, and after the sale





What We're Looking For:

Fluent in English with strong conversational skills





Proven ability to overcome objections and close sales on calls





Comfortable talking to U.S. customers and building rapport quickly





Detail-oriented with solid administrative follow-through





Able to work independently and take initiative without constant supervision





Experience with cleaning or home services (preferred but not required)





Technical Requirements:

title: Real Estate Virtual Assistant and Cold Caller
description:
We are a high-performance real estate investment and development firm operating in competitive U.S. markets. Our company specializes in strategic acquisitions, value-add opportunities, and off-market transactions. We are known for professionalism, precision, and execution.



We are expanding — and we are selectively opening a position for a Real Estate Cold Caller to support our acquisitions team.



This is not just a dialing job.

This is an opportunity to represent a serious investment firm where your voice directly contributes to real transactions and real growth.



We are looking for someone who understands the responsibility of representing a premier real estate company. Someone who communicates with confidence, handles objections with intelligence, and treats every call as a reflection of the firm.



What This Role Represents

 • You will be the first point of contact between property owners and our investment team

 • You will represent a respected and disciplined acquisition operation

 • You will work in a structured, performance-driven environment

 • You will grow with a company focused on long-term expansion



We do not hire casually. We are looking for individuals who take pride in professionalism and see this as a career opportunity, not temporary work.



What We Expect

 • Fluent English with a clear American accent

 • Proven real estate cold calling experience

 • Strong objection-handling skills

 • Professional phone presence

 • Reliable technical setup (fast internet + dual monitors)

 • Full-time availability (Monday–Friday, 9 AM – 7 PM EST)

Compensation begins at $500/month after the first month, with structured increases based on performance and contribution. Long-term growth opportunities are available for those who prove themselves.



Application Process



Due to the volume of interest, only serious applicants will be considered.



Please submit:

 • A short voice recording sample

 • 5 bullet points outlining your relevant experience



This is a selective opportunity to work with a serious real estate firm. We encourage applications from professionals who understand the value of representing excellence.

title: YouTube Channel Revamp Specialist (Project-Based Gig)
description:
San Diego Real Estate Brand



We are a high-producing San Diego real estate brand with 100+ existing YouTube videos.



The content quality is strong.

The channel structure, branding, and optimization are not.



We are hiring a project-based specialist to fully revamp the existing channel before moving into any long-term engagement.



This is a gig hire to rebuild the foundation correctly. If performance is strong, this can grow into a longer-term contract role.



Project Scope



1?? Revamp Existing Videos



• Audit current titles for SEO

• Rewrite titles for stronger click-through and local search

• Rewrite descriptions for keyword optimization + lead conversion

• Optimize tags

• Improve end screens and internal linking

• Structure pinned comments for conversion



Focus: San Diego real estate search intent.



2?? Rearrange & Rebuild Playlists



• Reorganize all videos into strategic playlists

• Build keyword-based playlist clusters

• Improve watch session flow

• Structure playlists around buyer intent (Living in San Diego, Neighborhood Tours, VA Buyers, Market Updates, etc.)

• Optimize playlist descriptions for SEO



Goal: Increase session duration and topical authority.



3?? Thumbnail Overhaul



• Develop a consistent thumbnail system

• Redesign high-opportunity videos first

• Improve click-through rate

• Align visual branding for authority positioning

• Create a repeatable thumbnail framework



We are not looking for “pretty.”

We are looking for clickable and strategic.



4?? Channel Bio + Link Optimization



• Rewrite channel bio for authority + trust

• Structure homepage layout for conversion

• Optimize all description links

• Improve funnel path (calls, forms, consultations)

• Strengthen local positioning (San Diego focus)



Goal: Turn viewers into inbound leads.



Deliverables

• Fully optimized existing videos

• Rebuilt playlists

• New thumbnail framework + applied redesign

• Optimized channel bio and links

• Brief summary document outlining changes made



Ideal Candidate

• Proven YouTube SEO experience

• Strong CTR and thumbnail psychology knowledge

• Experience optimizing existing channels (not just launching new ones)

• Can show measurable before-and-after results

• Strategic thinker, not just executor



Bonus if you have worked with real estate brands.



Please provide:

1. Channels you have revamped

2. Before/after performance examples

3. Your audit process

4. What you would fix first on our channel



Channel:

[
](
)



This is a foundational rebuild project.

If you execute at a high level, there is room to grow into a long-term contract role.

title: Bookkeeping / Admin VA

Schedule and Time Zone

Apply here:

title: Lodgements Specialist
description:
Position Description – Lodgements Specialist



Position Title: Lodgements Specialist

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Reporting To: Partner – Melbourne, Australia

Employment Type: Full-time



Role Purpose

The Lodgements Specialist is responsible for ensuring 100% of client lodgements are completed accurately and on time. This is a monitoring, coordination, and reporting role, acting as the central point of control between the Partner, accountants, bookkeepers, and clients.



This role does not primarily prepare accounting work but ensures all work is tracked, progressed, escalated, and lodged within required monthly and quarterly deadlines.



Key Objectives



Achieve zero late lodgements



Maintain real-time visibility of client lodgement status



Ensure bookkeeping is up to date to support accurate lodgements



Provide clear, proactive reporting to the Partner



Act early on risks, delays, or missing information



Key Responsibilities



1. Lodgement Monitoring & Control



Maintain a master lodgement tracker covering BAS (Monthly/Quarterly), IAS, PAYG, Superannuation, and other statutory lodgements as required



Monitor due dates and internal deadlines to ensure all lodgements are completed on time



Flag upcoming, overdue, or at-risk lodgements immediately



Ensure all lodgements are properly recorded and confirmed once completed



2. Bookkeeping Oversight



Monitor whether client bookkeeping is up to date and complete



Identify gaps, missing transactions, or delays that may impact lodgements



Coordinate with bookkeepers to prioritize work as deadlines approach



Escalate recurring bookkeeping issues to the Partner



3. Coordination & Follow-Ups



Coordinate work between accountants, bookkeepers, clients, and Partner



Follow up on missing client information, outstanding work, or unconfirmed lodgements



Ensure smooth handovers between bookkeeping and accounting teams



Keep communication clear, documented, and deadline-driven



4. Reporting & Communication



Provide regular lodgement status reports to the Partner (daily/weekly as required)



Highlight completed lodgements, upcoming deadlines, risks, or clients requiring attention



Communicate proactively with the Melbourne office to ensure no surprises



5. Process & System Discipline



Use firm systems, spreadsheets, or practice management tools to track all lodgements



Ensure data is accurate, up to date, and consistently maintained



Identify process gaps or recurring issues and suggest improvements



Support the Partner in strengthening lodgement control systems



Key Relationships



Partner – Melbourne (Direct Reporting)



Accountants



Bookkeepers



Clients (for follow-ups and missing information)



Skills & Experience



Essential:



Experience in accounting, bookkeeping, or practice administration



Strong understanding of BAS, IAS, PAYG, Super cycles, and monthly/quarterly lodgement workflows



Exceptional organizational and follow-up skills



Strong written and verbal English communication



Ability to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously



High attention to detail and accountability



Highly Regarded:



Experience working with Australian accounting firms



Familiarity with practice management software (e.g., Xero Practice Manager, Karbon, FYI)



Experience working remotely with Australian teams



Key Competencies



Proactive and deadline-driven



Comfortable chasing, escalating, and following up



Strong sense of ownership and responsibility



Clear, confident communicator across time zones



Structured, organized, and methodical



KPIs & Performance Measures



100% on-time lodgement rate



Zero missed statutory deadlines



Accuracy and completeness of lodgement tracking



Timeliness and quality of reporting to Partner



Reduction in last-minute lodgement risks



Responsiveness and communication effectiveness



Work Schedule



Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM (Melbourne time)



Fixed schedule, weekends off



Compensation & Benefits



Salary: PHP 40,000 – 50,000 per month, based on qualifications, experience, and interview



Leave credits after regularization



Fixed working hours with strong work–life balance



Opportunities for performance growth and career progression



Why Join Us?



Stable full-time role with predictable hours



Competitive salary based on experience



Supportive and process-driven environment



Clear expectations and measurable performance metrics



How to Apply:

Send your resume, cover letter, and a short video explaining why we should hire you.



Important: Add to the subject line: Lodgements Specialist

Applications without this subject line will not be shortlisted.

title: Sales Admin Analyst (FMCG experience)
description:
Sales Admin Analyst.



Premium Australian BPO is seeking an experienced Sales Support Analyst for our client, a global Fast-Moving-Consumer-Goods (FMCG) company specializing in personal care products and brands.



This Full-Time role offers the flexibility of Working-From-Home (WFH) during AUS business hours. Also offering a market leading salary package- including paid leave and bonuses. Join this global FMCG company, as a key player on their AUS and NZ sales teams. 



This role represents an incredible opportunity for both professional and personal growth and to fast-track your career on a global stage. 





****Key Responsibilities Include****



* Supporting the National Business Manager (NBM) with key data administrative tasks.

* Inputting key data into Trade Promotion Management (TPM) systems- specifically, Promax- ensuring data integrity and accuracy. 

* Accurate transfer of data from various sources into TPM/Promax systems. 

* Maintenance of baselines, promotions, pricing, forecasts and ensuring data integrity- what is loaded in Promax matches what is loaded in customer portals / promotional advice forms.  

* Providing key insights on data. 

* Identifying issues/discrepancies with data. 

* Reviewing forecast accuracy versus business plans. 

* Attending Pre S&OP Forecast meetings to take action notes and reflect actions/changes in Promax. 

* Assisting with data Audit requirements. Data matching from various sources. 

* Complete promotional reconciliation weekly or as required (Scan promotions vs accrued Scan monies) and provide written feedback on if the promotion met expectations, was below or above expectations. 

* Help prepare comprehensive sales data reports in Excel. Weekly & Monthly Sales Reports categorized by SKU, account, and area, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.

* Using Excel for data entry and data analysis. Pivot Tables, V Lookups, Sum & Average. 





****Key Requirements MUST HAVES include****  



* Strong background in sales and strong understanding of key sales principles. Including maintenance of baselines, promotions, pricing and forecast.  

* Expertise in Excel. Advanced functions including Pivot Tables, V Lookups, Sum & Average. 

* Excellent communication and comprehension skills. 

* Highest level of proficiency in English, both written and verbal.

* Ability to work as part of a cross functional team. 

* Meticulous attention to detail.

* Highly Analytical- able to interpret data, provide some analysis and data-driven recommendations.

* Highly organized- able to juggle multiple tasks, meeting timelines and deadlines.

* Attentive, communicative, analytical and energetic. A problem-solver who can work independently and as part of a dynamic team.



****IDEAL candidates have**** 



* At least 2 years proven previous experience within the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) industry.

*Have experience with Trade Promotion Management Systems (TPM) such as Promax, SAP or Oracle. 

* Have experience with Trade Promotion Optimization Tools (TPO). 

* Have a degree/background in Business Administration, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Accounting or a related field.



****You Will Be Provided With****

*Comprehensive training in Promax (TPM) and (TPO). 

*A work laptop. 



****You Will Be Responsible for Providing****

*A monitor

*Fast and Reliable Internet. 

*Back-up Internet options

*Back-up Power options.

*Having a designation WFH space- free from distraction. 





Please write a short cover letter detailing your relevant experience and skillset. You MUST include your CV as part of your application.



Thank you!

title: SEO Expert

Audits



Monthly results



Strategy updates

Technical SEO score improvements



On-time delivery of monthly deliverables

Required Experience

Strong understanding of:



Technical SEO



On-page optimisation



Content strategy



Link building

Ongoing learning and development

title: YouTube Video & Photo Editing Specialist
description:
Position Overview:

We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented YouTube Video and Photo Editing Specialist responsible for producing high-quality visual content aligned with brand guidelines and audience engagement goals. The ideal candidate combines technical editing skills with strong storytelling abilities, ensuring videos and images are polished, consistent, and optimized for digital platforms.

Talent Connect Inc is a U.S. Department of State–designated J-1 Visa sponsor organization specializing in internship and trainee programs. The Program Coordinator will be responsible for managing accounts, maintaining client relationships, providing exceptional customer service, and analyzing and editing program documents, maintain communicating with program participants and U.S. employers.



Key Responsibilities:

• Edit long-form and short-form YouTube videos, including interviews, vlogs, tutorials, promotional content, and social media clips.

• Perform color correction, audio balancing, motion graphics integration, subtitles, and transitions to enhance viewer retention.

• Design and edit thumbnails and promotional images optimized for YouTube performance and branding.

• Organize raw footage, maintain file structures, and manage version control for efficient production workflows.

• Collaborate with marketing and content teams to align edits with campaign objectives and publishing schedules.

• Optimize video formats, aspect ratios, and export settings for YouTube, Instagram, LinkedIn, and other platforms.

• Stay updated with YouTube trends, editing techniques, and platform algorithm best practices.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

• Proven experience editing YouTube content and digital photography.

• Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Lightroom, Final Cut Pro, or similar tools.

• Strong understanding of pacing, storytelling, and audience engagement strategies.

• Knowledge of YouTube SEO basics, thumbnails, and retention-focused editing.

• Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience creating motion graphics or basic animations.

title: APS Consulting Recruitment Notice
description:
APS Consulting is a Sydney-based advisory firm providing comprehensive strategic consulting services to clients worldwide. As we continue to expand our global footprint, we are seeking experienced Overseas Consultants with strong expertise in government relations, and a deep understanding of political affairs, economics, law, and public policy.



Scope of Work and Responsibilities  

Consultants in this role primarily support research, policy analysis, and advisory work related to overseas political, regulatory, and governance developments. Typical tasks include:



Conducting background research and policy monitoring



Stakeholder mapping and engagement analysis



Drafting analytical briefs and memos



Supporting scenario planning and risk assessments for client decision-making



Types of Clients and Projects  

Our clients generally include private enterprises, professional institutions, and organizations with cross-border interests that require an informed understanding of overseas political, regulatory, or public-sector environments. Projects are research- and analysis-driven, and may relate to:



Public policy trends



Government processes



Geopolitical risk assessments



Work Structure (approximately 20 hours per week)  

This is a flexible, part-time consultancy arrangement. Work is typically project-based, with weekly hours varying depending on deliverables and timelines. Coordination is conducted remotely, and schedules are discussed in advance to align with both project requirements and consultant availability.



Preferred Backgrounds  

Candidates with prior experience in the following sectors will be given priority consideration:



Government or public administration



Law firms or legal advisory institutions



Media or strategic communications organizations



Think tanks or research institutions



Consulting or public relations firms



Non-governmental or international organizations



Compensation and Benefits  

We offer competitive compensation packages and flexible work arrangements tailored to global professionals.



Application  

For inquiries or application submission, please contact us at:





Or visit our website:

title: System Administrator
description:
About the Role

We are looking for two skilled and proactive System Administrators to join our MSP team. These roles will support a diverse client base, ensuring smooth IT operations, managing systems, and resolving technical issues efficiently.



Key Responsibilities:

, and solutions to maintain knowledge base.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
We Don't Need Customer Service Reps. We Need Brand Ambassadors Who Create Raving Fans.

Customer Service Representative



Most CS reps close tickets. You'll turn frustrated customers into loyal advocates.

About Rescale Media

We're not just another e-commerce company. We're a brand incubator on a mission to build enduring, value-driven brands that bring meaningful products into families' lives.

We've scaled from just drop shipping to a 30+ person team doing $1M+/month. Our goal? Multi 9-figures. And we're just getting started.

???? Learn more at 
dia



Our Core Values

???? GENIUSES & OWNERS We partner with builders who think like founders. Not employees waiting to be told what to do—owners who see a problem and fix it.

? ITERATIONS > HOURS We don't measure success by time at your desk. We measure it by how fast you can test, learn, and improve. Ship it. Learn. Repeat.

???? TRUTH OVER EGO We prioritize honesty and clarity, even when it's uncomfortable. No politics. No BS. Just data and results.

The Role

Every customer interaction is a chance to either build brand loyalty or destroy it. We need someone who understands that customer service isn't a cost center—it's a growth driver.

You'll be the voice of our brands to customers worldwide. Our brands serve families who care deeply about the products they bring into their homes. They deserve service that matches the care we put into our products.

This isn't about following scripts. It's about solving problems, exceeding expectations, and turning complaints into compliments.



What You'll Do

Handle customer inquiries across
, chat, and social channels

Resolve issues quickly and thoroughly—first contact resolution is the goal

Process orders, returns, and exchanges according to our policies

Escalate complex issues appropriately and follow through to resolution

Document customer feedback and surface trends to leadership

Contribute to FAQ and knowledge base content

Maintain customer satisfaction scores above targets

Coordinate with suppliers and fulfillment partners to resolve shipping issues



What We're Looking For

2+ years of customer service experience in e-commerce

Excellent written English

Experience with helpdesk tools (Gorgias, Zendesk, Reamaze, or similar)

Problem-solving mindset—you find solutions, not excuses

Patience and empathy—even with difficult customers

Ability to work independently and manage your own queue



Bonus Points:

Reamaze experience

Dropshipping or fulfillment operations experience

Germany market experience (German language skills a plus)

Shopify experience

You've handled high-volume CS in peak seasons

Experience turning angry customers into 5-star reviews



This Role Is NOT For...

We're being direct because we respect your time:

People who see CS as just a stepping stone

Those who can't stay calm with upset customers

Anyone who follows scripts without thinking

People who need constant supervision to stay productive



Compensation & Benefits

???? Monthly Salary: $700 - $1,000/month

Plus:

Monthly performance bonuses tied to company Operating Profit (5-25% of salary)

Quarterly profit pool distribution (2-7.5% of company profits shared among team)

Remote-first environment

Work with a team of A-players who actually give a damn

Direct founder access—no layers of bureaucracy

Real ownership of your domain—we don't micromanage



Our Hiring Process

We don't waste time—yours or ours. Here's how it works:

Step 1: Application (You're here!)

Step 2: Initial Interview with Founder

Step 3: Internal Assessment by Rescale

Step 4: WhatsApp update for next steps

Step 5: Signing of Independent Contractor and NDA

Step 6: Onboarding and Training

Total timeline: 1 week from application to offer.



Ready to Apply?

https://rescalemedia.clickup.com/forms/9016479971/f/8cpt473-80296/OVAOS1JJ0T6ZFI4HEG

Complete the application form above. Be thorough—this is your first impression.



P.S. Our best CS rep once turned an angry 1-star review into a 5-star review AND a repeat purchase—in one conversation. If you understand how that's possible, we want to hear from you.

P.P.S. If you're reading this far, you're already more thorough than 90% of applicants. That's exactly who we want.

description:

About the Company

The company is a customer-focused service provider committed to delivering reliable solutions and an excellent customer experience. Known for high service standards, the organization supports customers through responsive, professional, and efficient service.



Role Overview

As a Customer Service Agent based in Manila, you will handle customer inquiries, resolve account-related concerns, and ensure a smooth and professional customer experience. You will collaborate closely with internal teams to maintain service quality and meet performance standards.



Qualifications:

- Minimum 1 year of experience in customer service or contact centre roles.

-Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills.

title: Conversion Rate Optimizer
description:
Stop A/B Testing Buttons. Start Engineering Revenue Per Visitor.

CRO Specialist - Full Funnel Conversion Optimization

Most CRO specialists tweak landing pages. You'll own the entire funnel—from advertorial to checkout to upsell sequence.

About Rescale Media

We're not just another e-commerce company. We're a brand incubator on a mission to build enduring, value-driven brands that bring meaningful products into families' lives.

We've scaled from just drop shipping to a 30+ person team doing $1M+/month. Our goal? Multi 9-figures. And we're just getting started.

???? Learn more at 
dia



Our Core Values

???? GENIUSES & OWNERS We partner with builders who think like founders. Not employees waiting to be told what to do—owners who see a problem and fix it.

? ITERATIONS > HOURS We don't measure success by time at your desk. We measure it by how fast you can test, learn, and improve. Ship it. Learn. Repeat.

???? TRUTH OVER EGO We prioritize honesty and clarity, even when it's uncomfortable. No politics. No BS. Just data and results.



The Role

Every visitor we acquire costs money. Your job is to extract maximum value from each one—across the entire funnel.

This isn't a "tweak the headline and call it a day" role. You'll own optimization from the 
nt someone clicks an ad to the 
nt they complete their final upsell purchase.

The funnel you'll own:

Advertorials - Pre-sell pages that warm up traffic

Sales Pages - Core offer pages that convert browsers to buyers

Upsell Sequences - Post-purchase flows that maximize AOV

We're doing millions in revenue. A 10% lift at any stage compounds across the entire funnel. If you can systematically improve each step, you'll be one of the most valuable people in the company.



What You'll Do

Own full-funnel conversion optimization across all brand sites

Build complete upsell sequences from scratch - not just optimize existing ones

Analyze user behavior data to identify friction and drop-off points

Develop and prioritize testing roadmap based on revenue impact

Design and run A/B tests (advertorials, sales pages, checkout, upsells)

Analyze test results and document learnings

Collaborate with designers and developers on implementation

Monitor funnel performance and identify issues before they impact revenue

Build dashboards to track conversion metrics at every stage



What We're Looking For

2+ years of CRO experience in e-commerce

Proven experience building upsell sequences from scratch (this is non-negotiable)

Experience optimizing advertorials and long-form sales pages

Strong analytics skills (Microsoft Clarity, heatmaps, session recordings)

Understanding of statistical significance and experiment design

Experience with Shopify or similar e-commerce platforms

Ability to write clear test hypotheses and document results

Bonus Points:

Experience with high-traffic sites (100K+ monthly visitors)

Background in direct response copywriting

Experience with post-purchase upsell tools (CartHook, ReConvert, etc.)

You've delivered measurable AOV lifts through upsell optimization (and can prove it)



This Role Is NOT For...

We're being direct because we respect your time:

People who have only optimized landing pages, not full funnels

Those who tweak existing upsell pages but have never built one from scratch

Anyone who can't explain the math behind statistical significance

People who test random things without hypotheses

Those who can't prioritize high-impact over easy wins



Compensation & Benefits

???? Monthly Salary: $1,500 - $2,000/month

Plus:

Monthly performance bonuses tied to company Operating Profit (5-25% of salary)

Quarterly profit pool distribution (2-7.5% of company profits shared among team)

Remote-first environment (European timezone preferred)

Work with a team of A-players who actually give a damn

Direct founder access—no layers of bureaucracy

Real ownership of your domain—we don't micromanage



Our Hiring Process

We don't waste time—yours or ours. Here's how it works:

Step 1: Application (You're here!)

Step 2: Initial Interview with Founder

Step 3: Internal Assessment by Rescale

Step 4: WhatsApp update for next steps

Step 5: Signing of Independent Contractor and NDA

Step 6: Onboarding and Training

Total timeline: 1 week from application to offer.



Ready to Apply?

Apply Here - 

Complete the application form above. Be thorough—this is your first impression.

P.S. One of our upsell sequences added $15+ to our AOV. If you can build flows like that, we want to talk.

P.P.S. If you're reading this far, you're already more thorough than 90% of applicants. That's exactly who we want.

title: VIDEO EDITOR
description:
We Don't Need a Video Editor. We Need a Performance Creative Machine Who Makes Ads That Print Money.

Video Editor - Performance Creatives

Most video editors make pretty videos. You'll make ads that stop the scroll and scale to millions in spend.



About Rescale Media

We're not just another e-commerce company. We're a brand incubator on a mission to build enduring, value-driven brands that bring meaningful products into families' lives.

We've scaled from just drop shipping to a 30+ person team doing $1M+/month. Our goal? Multi 9-figures. And we're just getting started.



???? Learn more at 
dia

Our Core Values

???? GENIUSES & OWNERS We partner with builders who think like founders. Not employees waiting to be told what to do—owners who see a problem and fix it.

? ITERATIONS > HOURS We don't measure success by time at your desk. We measure it by how fast you can test, learn, and improve. Ship it. Learn. Repeat.

???? TRUTH OVER EGO We prioritize honesty and clarity, even when it's uncomfortable. No politics. No BS. Just data and results.



The Role

You won't be making corporate videos or cinematic masterpieces. You'll be making ads that convert—fast-paced, scroll-stopping content that turns viewers into buyers.

You'll work directly with our Creative Strategists who develop the concepts and hooks. Your job is to bring those concepts to life with edits that hit hard in the first second and keep people watching.

We test a lot of creative. That means volume matters. You need to be fast without sacrificing quality—and smart enough to know which details matter and which don't.



What You'll Do

Edit direct response video ads for Meta, TikTok, and other platforms

Transform raw UGC footage, b-roll, and assets into high-converting ads

Execute on creative briefs from our Creative Strategists

Produce multiple ad variations and iterations quickly

Add motion graphics, text overlays, captions, and sound design

Maintain organized project files and asset libraries

Hit deadlines consistently—we move fast

Learn from performance data and apply insights to future edits

What We're Looking For

2+ years of video editing experience

Strong proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro or CapCut

Portfolio of direct response or social media ads you've edited

Understanding of what makes content work on Meta/TikTok (pacing, hooks, trends)

Ability to work fast without sacrificing quality

Experience with motion graphics and text animation

Strong attention to detail—audio sync, color, pacing all matter

Bonus Points:

Experience editing for DTC/e-commerce brands

After Effects skills for motion graphics

Understanding of direct response principles

You've edited ads that actually scaled

Experience with UGC-style content



This Role Is NOT For...

We're being direct because we respect your time:

Editors who only know cinematic/narrative work

Those who can't handle high volume and fast turnarounds

Anyone who needs hand-holding on every edit

People who take feedback personally instead of professionally

Editors who think the algorithm is wrong when an ad doesn't perform



Compensation & Benefits

Monthly Salary: $1,000/month

title: Google Ads / PPC Specialist - Local Lead Generation (Health & Wellness)
description:
Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Google Ads Specialist to audit and fix our long-standing campaigns for 
. Our current setup is outdated and needs a "no-bullshit" overhaul to maximize leads while minimizing wasted spend.

Key Responsibilities:

• Campaign Audit & Restructuring: Review existing legacy campaigns and restructure them for better performance.

• Negative Keyword Management: Implement a rigorous negative keyword strategy to stop paying for irrelevant clicks.

• Landing Page Alignment: Ensure all ads are focused on specific, relevant pages of 
 rather than just the homepage.

• Location Targeting: Properly set up geo-targeting specifically for the Windsor-Essex County area.

• Ongoing Optimization: Conduct weekly bid adjustments and performance monitoring focused on conversions, not just clicks.

Requirements:

• Minimum 3+ years of Google Ads experience.

• Proven track record with service-based local businesses.

• Ability to explain strategies and results in a direct, factual manner.

• Experience with Google Analytics and conversion tracking.

• Ad Copywriting & A/B Testing: "Drafting compelling, patient-centric ad copy that avoids 'bullshit' and focuses on real benefits. You must run A/B tests to see which headlines perform best".

• Quality Score Optimization: "Focusing on improving Quality Scores by ensuring ads, keywords, and landing pages on 
 are perfectly aligned to lower our Cost Per Click (CPC)".

• Advanced Tracking Setup: "Verifying that Google Tag Manager and GA4 are tracking actual conversions (form fills, phone calls) and not just 'clicks'".

• Competitor Analysis: "Monitoring local competitors in the Windsor-Essex area to ensure our positioning remains superior".

Add to "Requirements"

• Compliance Knowledge: "Deep understanding of Google’s healthcare advertising policies to ensure our ads aren't flagged or suspended".

• Analytical Skills: "Ability to turn complex data into simple, actionable weekly reports. You must be able to explain 'the why' behind every change".

• Landing Page Proficiency: "Experience advising on landing page layout and 'Call to Action' (CTA) placement to improve conversion rates".

"To prove you’ve read this, please start your cover letter with the phrase 'Quality Score Matters' and list three specific negative keywords you would immediately add to a local health clinic's account for a page on anxiety.”

? Timeline

NDA
