title: SEO Specialist
description:
We are a fast-growing Business Advisory and Coaching company helping business owners and leaders scale smarter, perform better, and build high-value organisations. Our work combines practical advisory with leadership and executive coaching to drive real, measurable outcomes.



We are looking for an SEO Specialist who wants to own organic growth and turn search into a predictable acquisition engine. If rankings, traffic, and performance metrics motivate you, this role gives you the space to build, optimise, and scale.



About the Role

This is a hands-on growth role. You will design and execute SEO strategies that increase visibility, attract qualified traffic, and support lead generation across our advisory and coaching services.



We are not looking for surface-level SEO. We want someone who understands strategy, technical foundations, content optimisation, and how SEO directly supports business performance.



What You’ll Be Doing

Developing and executing SEO strategy aligned with business goals

Conducting high-intent keyword research

Optimising on-page content for search performance

Identifying and resolving technical SEO issues

Collaborating on content strategy to drive organic growth

Monitoring rankings, traffic, and performance metrics

Running audits and implementing continuous improvements

Analysing competitors and identifying growth opportunities

Reporting insights and actionable recommendations



What We’re Looking For

Proven SEO experience with measurable results

Strong understanding of on-page, off-page, and technical SEO

Data-driven, performance-focused mindset

Familiarity with SEO and analytics tools

Clear communication and reporting skills

Self-driven, organised, and results-oriented

Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment

Someone who takes ownership and pushes for growth



Nice to Have

Experience with SEO for professional services, advisory, or coaching businesses

Content optimisation with a conversion-focused approach



Compensation & Incentives

Salary is negotiable and will depend on skills, experience, and demonstrated capability. Bonuses and performance incentives are available for the right candidate who consistently achieves agreed KPIs and objectives. We reward measurable impact and contribution to growth.



Work Structure

Full-time remote role

Hours: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Sydney, Australia time

One-hour lunch break

Results-driven culture with clear expectations



What Success Looks Like

Strong improvements in rankings for high-value keywords

Growth in qualified organic traffic

SEO contributing directly to lead generation

Ongoing optimisation and performance gains



How to Apply

If you believe you are the right fit for this role, please send your application to 
 with the subject line: SEO Specialist Application – [Your Name].

Your application must include the following:

Cover Letter outlining your experience and why you're a great fit for the role

Your Resume with relevant work experience

Portfolio or examples of previous work showcasing your skills and expertise



A brief outline of what you are looking for in a job and from the company you work for

Candidates must be able to demonstrate and provide evidence of previous results, including examples of successful campaigns, measurable outcomes, and relevant work experience.



Please note that applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered or replied to.

title: Customer Service Manager / Dispute manager
description:
About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Dispute Manager / Customer Service Manager with proven dropshipping experience to join our growing e-commerce team. You will be responsible for overseeing customer service operations for multiple dropshipping stores, with a strong focus on dispute resolution, including chargebacks and PayPal disputes.

This role is specifically suited for someone who has hands-on experience in dropshipping customer service, understands the unique challenges of supplier-related issues, shipping delays, refunds, and dispute management, and knows how to balance customer satisfaction with business protection.

You should be detail-oriented, calm under pressure, and experienced in handling complex customer cases that cannot be resolved by automated systems alone.



Key Responsibilities

Manage customer service operations for multiple dropshipping stores

Handle complex customer cases escalated from our AI customer service bot, particularly those related to shipping, supplier issues, and refunds

Manage and dispute chargebacks (Visa, Mastercard, etc.)

Handle PayPal disputes and claims professionally and efficiently

Collect, organize, and submit compelling evidence to win disputes and chargebacks

Work with and optimize chargeback prevention tools and apps

Maintain clear, professional communication with customers while protecting the business

Monitor dispute ratios and implement strategies to reduce future disputes

Collaborate with the team to improve customer service workflows specifically for dropshipping operations



Requirements

Minimum 2 years of experience in customer service and/or dispute handling, preferably within dropshipping

Proven experience with chargebacks and PayPal disputes is required

Demonstrable experience in dropshipping customer service is a must

Familiarity with chargeback prevention tools/apps is a plus

Strong written English communication skills

Highly organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

Able to work independently and make well-judged decisions

Comfortable handling supplier-related issues, shipping delays, and refund disputes



What We Offer

A friendly, supportive, and professional work environment

Fully remote position

Long-term collaboration for the right candidate

Opportunity to grow with a fast-scaling dropshipping e-commerce business



How to Apply

Please apply with:

A short introduction about yourself

Your relevant experience in dropshipping customer service, chargebacks, and PayPal disputes

Examples (if possible) of disputes or chargebacks you have successfully handled

We look forward to working with someone who takes ownership of customer satisfaction while protecting the company’s interests in a fast-paced dropshipping environment.

We’re looking for a Bookkeeper to support our growing e-commerce business, with a strong focus on 3PL, fulfillment, and logistics-related accounting.



This is not a basic data-entry role. We need someone who understands how inventory movement, fulfillment fees, shipping costs, and chargebacks flow through the books and can keep everything accurate and reconciled.



You’ll work closely with operations and leadership to ensure our financials reflect what’s actually happening across sales, fulfillment, and logistics.



What You’ll Do



• Maintain accurate bookkeeping for e-commerce operations

• Reconcile bank accounts, credit cards, and payment processors

• Track and reconcile 3PL invoices, fulfillment, storage, and shipping fees

• Ensure refunds, reships, and chargebacks are recorded correctly

• Match platform revenue with fulfillment and logistics data

• Prepare monthly summaries and basic financial reports

• Flag discrepancies between sales, payouts, and 3PL charges

• Keep records clean, documented, and audit-ready



Who We’re Looking For



• Proven bookkeeping experience for e-commerce businesses

• Hands-on experience working with 3PL or fulfillment partners

• Strong understanding of shipping, storage, and fulfillment fee structures

• Experience with QuickBooks, Xero, or similar tools

• High attention to detail and accuracy

• Clear written English communication



Bonus if You



• Have worked with Shopify + 3PL providers

• Understand inventory-related accounting concepts

• Have reconciled complex 3PL invoices before

• Can proactively flag operational or process gaps



Apply here:

title: Landing Page Developer (No-code page builder) – eCommerce (Remote)
description:
Build high-converting landing pages. Work fast. Make an impact.



We are an 8+ year old eCommerce group running multiple online brands, and we’re looking for an experienced Landing Page Developer to join our team.



Your core job will be simple and clear:



To build landing pages with landing page builder apps that support our marketing funnels, and help maintain the online store through updates, optimizations, and fixes when required.



This role is designed for someone who already knows how to build landing pages, understands conversion-focused design, and wants a stable long-term position with a growing eCommerce business.





What we offer

- Salary: $600 USD per month

- Employment Type: Part-time, 20 hours per week (4 hours per day) 

- Location: Remote

- Leave: 10 days of paid time off and 5 days of sick leave annually



Who This Role Is For

This job is perfect for you if:

- You enjoy building landing pages 

- You already have real experience creating pages for eCommerce brands

- You can take a design and bring it to life without hand-holding

- You work fast and take pride in your work

- You want a long-term role instead of random freelance gigs



We are not looking for beginners.



We want someone who can join the team and start making an impact quickly.



Process training is provided





What You’ll Be Doing

As our Landing Page Developer, you will:

- Build and maintain landing pages from provided designs and mockups, including advertorials, listicles, sales pages, promotional pages, and product-focused landing pages.

- Accurately duplicate and implement designs from swipe files and creative references, ensuring pixel-perfect execution.

- Ensure all pages are fully responsive and functional across desktop, tablet, and mobile screen sizes.

- Work closely with the marketing and creative teams to launch new campaigns, iterate on pages, and implement updates quickly.





Required Experience & Skills

- Real experience building landing pages for eCommerce brands.

- Hands-on experience with page builders, preferably Gempages (or similar platforms like Replo, Shogun, PageFly, Unbounce, or Webflow).

- Ability to turn mockups into finished pages quickly and accurately, working from Figma files, briefs, and swipe references.

- Strong grasp of responsive design, ensuring pages look and perform perfectly on desktop, tablet, and mobile.

- High attention to detail and layout fundamentals, including typography, spacing, and visual structure.

- Self-sufficient and fast-working, able to deliver quality pages with minimal supervision.

- Comfortable working remotely with Slack and ClickUp.





Growth Opportunity



This role is built for the long term.

If you perform well, you will:

- Transition to full-time

- Become a core member of our marketing team

- Take ownership of landing page production

- Grow alongside a fast-moving team

- Unlock quarterly performance bonuses



We are looking for someone experienced, reliable, and fast.



If you’re a landing page developer who enjoys building high-quality pages and wants a stable long-term role with an eCommerce company, this is for you.





How to Apply

To be considered, please include:

- Example portfolio of landing pages you’ve built

- Platforms you have experience with (Gempages, Replo, etc.)

- Your current availability

- Short description of your experience with eCommerce pages

- Please submit your responses using this form


 



Important:

Applications without real landing page examples will not be reviewed.

title: PODCAST EDITOR
description:
Superline Network is hiring a full-time Podcast Editor to manage the post-production workflow for our interview and business content series. This role is responsible not only for editing, but for owning the entire episode delivery process from raw footage to publish-ready content across YouTube and social platforms.



Responsibilities include:

 • Editing long-form podcast and interview episodes (multi-camera)

 • Syncing audio/video and building a clean narrative cut

 • Removing filler, pauses, and off-topic sections to improve pacing and retention

 • Color correction, audio leveling, and basic sound cleanup

 • Adding graphics, lower thirds, subtitles, and branded elements

 • Creating YouTube-ready exports, thumbnails guidance, and timestamps

 • Cutting multiple short-form clips (Reels/Shorts/TikTok) from each episode

 • Organizing footage, backing up files, and maintaining project archives

 • Working with the content team to meet weekly publishing deadlines



Requirements:

 • Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro (required)

 • Strong understanding of YouTube pacing and viewer retention

 • Experience editing interview or podcast content

 • Ability to meet deadlines consistently and communicate proactively

 • Reliable internet and ability to transfer large media files

 • Bonus: After Effects or motion graphics experience



We are looking for someone detail-oriented who can take raw footage and independently deliver a polished, platform-ready episode with minimal oversight.
salary: $150 PER LONG FORM EDIT / $20 PER SHORT

title: Virtual Assistant (Kajabi & Creative Marketing Specialist)
description:

The Role

This role is perfect for someone who loves the intersection of digital marketing and technical systems. You will be the "behind-the-scenes" engine helping to turn ideas into beautiful landing pages and engaging social media content.

How to Apply

:

title: Social Media and Video Editor VA
description:
Overview

We are seeking a creative, detail-driven Social Media Virtual Assistant to support a high-end luxury villa rental business. This business serves international high-net-worth clients and offers ultra-high-end accommodations alongside curated lifestyle experiences.



This is not "influencer-style" or trend-heavy marketing; it requires taste, restraint, and a deep understanding of luxury hospitality. We are looking for a specialist who understands that luxury is about care and editorial elegance. You will work with a solo operator who values being “managed” and kept accountable.



Work Schedule & Compensation

Hours: Permanent part-time role, 2 days per week (16 hours total).

Rate of Pay: ?300 per hour.



Key Responsibilities

1. Social Media Management & Growth

Platform Setup: Create and link a
 page to the existing Instagram account and establish a new TikTok presence.

Content Creation: Use supplied high-end photo and video assets to create refined, intentional posts and reels using Canva and CapCut.

Engagement: Manage and grow interactions with aligned high-end travel, yachting, hospitality, and lifestyle accounts.

Editorial Writing: Draft elegant, calm captions for approval that avoid “cheesy” styling and reflect a magazine-like aesthetic.



2. Brand & Systems Support

Asset Management: Organize brand assets (logos, fonts, neutral palettes) and maintain a shared Google Drive for weekly assets.

Website Content: Assist with basic website updates, such as adding meta titles to property listings.

Client Outreach: Draft professional, refined
 follow-ups to past clients.

Proactive Planning: Provide weekly content ideas and platform/tool recommendations (CRM, workflows) without being chased.



Required Skills & Experience

Luxury Aesthetic: Proven experience managing social media for premium brands (hospitality, real estate, or high-end travel preferred).

Visual Excellence: Strong video editing skills for polished, short-form content.

Platform Mastery: Proficiency in Instagram, TikTok, Meta Ads, and Canva Pro.

Communication: Excellent written English with a calm, sophisticated tone.

Organization: Highly reliable and able to work independently without micromanagement.



Personality & Work Style Fit

Calm & Thoughtful: You take pride in high-quality work and understand that luxury branding is intentional.

Proactive: You don't wait to be told what to do; you bring ideas and provide "supportive accountability" to keep projects moving.

Aesthetic Sensitivity: You prefer "magazine aesthetics," neutral palettes, and balanced layouts over loud social media trends.



Application Instructions

Please include the following in your application:

Portfolio: Examples of social media accounts or content you have managed for premium brands.

Video Samples: Samples of your polished video editing work.

Personal Note: A brief explanation of why this specific type of luxury, "calm" brand appeals to you.

Note: Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a paid trial task to confirm visual alignment and brand sensitivity.



To Apply:

Should you be interested, kindly fill out the application form: 
/appgWJZPZOmqW3xQl/pagX70SRLuI0D6zJq/form and put HYODESIGNER in the Job Title.

title: Virtual Assistant – Finance & CRM Support (Debt Advisory)
description:
We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to join our growing debt advisory and

capital markets team. In this role, you’ll play a key part in keeping our clients’ information organized,

supporting smooth workflows, managing our CRM (HubSpot), and helping create polished, lender-ready

presentations.



This isn’t a typical admin job - you’ll be working closely with financial documents, spreadsheets, and

structured processes, helping us keep everything running efficiently while making a real impact on our

clients’ experience. If you enjoy staying organized, taking initiative, and contributing to a fast-paced

professional environment, this role is a perfect fit.



Key Responsibilities

Client Onboarding & Document Management

• Set up and manage secure client data rooms (Google Drive, Dropbox, SharePoint)

• Create and maintain standardized folder structures

• Distribute document request lists and track received vs. missing items

• Follow up with clients on outstanding documents

• Maintain version control and confidentiality



Financial Document Organization

• Collect and organize: financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow), bank statements, tax

returns, AR/AP aging, and debt schedules

• Ensure consistent file naming and date formats

• Flag missing documents or periods (no minimal interpretation required)

CRM Administration (HubSpot)

• Create and update contacts, companies, and deals

• Maintain clean and consistent CRM records

• Update deal stages, notes, and activity logs

• Generate basic pipeline reports



PowerPoint & Presentation Support

• Prepare draft pitch decks using provided templates

• Populate slides with provided financial and company data

• Proofread and format lender-ready materials

• Create lender-specific versions when needed



Scheduling & Admin Support

• Coordinate meetings and manage calendars

• Send invites, agendas, and follow-ups

• Maintain internal trackers and process checklists

• Assist with document editing and light research



Qualifications

• At least 2 years of experience as a Virtual Assistant supporting finance, advisory, lending, real

estate, or other professional services businesses preferably with a finance or accounting focus

• Experience working with CRM systems, preferably HubSpot, or similar platforms

• Strong professional customer service and written communication skills

• Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines

• Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs,

Drive)

• Comfortable working with spreadsheets, structured data, and financial documents

• Strong time management skills with a high level of discretion and confidentiality

• Self-motivated and able to work independently while following established SOPs

• Reliable internet connection and a professional home office setup

• Availability during Mountain Standard Time (MST) business hours

• Comfortable using a time-tracking system

• Must have a valid NBI Clearance



How to Apply:

Send a link to your resume and a cover letter highlighting your experience in property management, preferably using Rentvine



We’re excited to find the right fit for our team!

title: Outbound Cold Caller for U.S. Based Leads
description:
Outbound Cold Caller for U.S. Based Leads



Hi there!



We’re hiring a remote, phone-based outbound caller to support a rapidly growing Phone Sales program calling independent U.S. natural grocery stores. Clear, accent-neutral spoken English is required, as you’ll be speaking directly with U.S. store staff all day. The ability to think on your feet to navigate gatekeepers and buyer questions in a non-salesy demeanor is also required. This is a soft sales position.



This role is focused on outbound calls to retail stores to secure new free placements and to drive reorders from stores where free placements have already been made. The primary objective is to obtain a verbal yes on the call, while also collecting the necessary contact information, such as an
 address, to support follow-up and order execution.



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who:

- Speaks fluent English with a neutral or near-neutral accent

- Has a minimum of two years of experience in the BPO industry, appointment setting, or telemarketing sales.

- Has excellent internet connection and a HIGH quality headset (see below)

- Can show up consistently, on time, every day

- Is confident and comfortable making outbound calls + can think on your feet



Work Schedule (Required)

- Full-time: Monday to Friday

- Hours: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST)

- You must be punctual and available every day during this time — no exceptions.



Initial Application Instructions

To apply, please complete this short form:



You’ll be asked to:

- Upload a 2–4 minute Loom video answering the questions listed below

- Share a screenshot of your internet speed test

- Provide details about your internet provider, computer, and headset setup



Loom Video Instructions

Please record a Loom video (2–4 minutes) answering the following:



1. What’s your name and where are you located?

2. Tell us about your work experience — especially related to phone calls or outbound work.

3. Describe your ability to think on your feet and navigate objections or gatekeepers.

4. How would you rate your English (1–10) and why?

5. Why do you want to work with our team?

6. Are you comfortable working 9–5 EST and making daily outbound calls?

7. Your internet speed and provider, and whether you can connect via wired ethernet/LAN.

8. Briefly describe your headset, how it connects to your computer, and your work environment.



*Please speak naturally — DON’T read a script. We want to get a sense of your real communication style.*



Compensation:

Rate: $4–$6+ USD per hour (depending on experience & bonus)

Bonus for each successful placement or reorder



It is very achievable to earn $8/hour or more once bonuses are included — even with modest success.



This is not a hard-selling role — free placements and reorders are quite common and easy to attain for most brands/products you will be selling.



Think you’re a great fit? We’d love to hear from you! We review applications as they come in! Apply now and take the first step in joining a fast-growing, mission-driven team!

title: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT – INSTAGRAM SALES & GROWTH OPERATOR
description:
Brand: Vibration Plate



Role Overview



We are looking for a highly disciplined, sales-driven Virtual Assistant to operate our Instagram account for the brand Vibration Plate. This role is responsible for outreach, DM sales conversations, comment-based prospecting, and consistent posting with the singular goal of turning attention into Shopify sales.



If you are afraid of numbers, persuasion, or accountability — this is not the role.



???? CORE OBJECTIVE



Turn Instagram engagement into daily sales by:



Proactively starting conversations



Responding to inbound DMs fast



Guiding customers to the exact vibration plate that fits their needs



Sending them directly to checkout



???? DAILY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. OUTREACH (EXPLORE PAGE PROSPECTING)



You will:



Find high-performing Instagram posts on the Explore page related to:



Lymphatic drainage



Weight loss



Wellness



Fitness recovery



At-home workouts



Click into comments on those posts



Identify users who show purchase intent (questions, curiosity, pain points)



Visit their profiles and send a non-spammy, natural DM to start a conversation



???? This is manual, intentional outreach — not mass spam.



2. INBOUND DM SALES (MOST IMPORTANT)



You will:



Respond to ALL incoming DMs within 15–30 minutes



Ask qualifying questions (goals, budget, experience level)



Match the customer to the correct vibration plate (entry, mid, or premium)



Send the exact product link



Push them to checkout, not “think about it”



You are not a chatbot.

You are a closer.



3. COMMENT MONITORING & RESPONSE



Monitor comments on our posts and viral reels



Respond in a way that:



Builds trust publicly



Pulls people into DMs



Soft-directs them toward purchasing



4. CONTENT POSTING (CONSISTENCY = MONEY)



You will:



Post at least 2–3 times per day



Reels



Carousels



Short captions optimized for conversion



Repost high-performing reels to Stories daily



Pin top-performing posts



Follow posting schedules provided by us



?? Consistency matters more than perfection.



5. TRACKING & REPORTING



You will report daily:



Number of DMs sent



Number of DM conversations started



Number of checkout links sent



Number of purchases attributed to DMs



Any objections or patterns you notice



If it doesn’t move revenue, it doesn’t matter.



???? IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE



You are:



Comfortable talking to strangers online



Persuasive but not pushy



Fast responder (speed = sales)



Obsessed with results, not tasks



Able to follow scripts and adapt when needed



Willing to learn customer psychology



Experience with:

title: Advanced Drop Shipping Manager
description:
We are looking for an Advanced Dropshipping Manager with proven experience scaling profitable dropshipping stores. This role requires deep knowledge of product research, supplier management, order fulfillment, customer support systems, ad-to-fulfillment workflows, and platform compliance.



This is not an entry-level role. We are seeking someone who understands how to build, optimize, and scale dropshipping operations efficiently while minimizing risk, chargebacks, and platform issues.



?



Key Responsibilities



Store & Platform Management

 • Fully manage and optimize dropshipping stores (Shopify, TikTok Shop, or similar)

 • Ensure compliance with platform policies and payment processor rules

 • Monitor store health, disputes, chargebacks, and account risks

 • Implement SOPs for smooth daily operations



Product Research & Validation

 • Identify winning products using data-driven research

 • Analyze trends, competitor stores, and ad performance

 • Test products efficiently and scale proven winners

 • Remove underperforming or high-risk products



Supplier & Fulfillment Management

 • Source reliable suppliers (agents, private suppliers, or warehouses)

 • Negotiate pricing, shipping times, and quality control

 • Monitor fulfillment speed, tracking accuracy, and delivery success

 • Handle supplier issues, delays, and replacements



Order & Inventory Operations

 • Oversee order processing and fulfillment workflows

 • Track inventory levels and prevent stock shortages

 • Manage refunds, returns, and reshipments

 • Reduce delivery complaints and refund rates



Customer Support & Experience

 • Set up and manage customer support systems

 • Ensure fast, professional responses to customer inquiries

 • Handle escalations, disputes, and unhappy customers

 • Maintain high customer satisfaction and low chargeback rates



Sales & Scaling

 • Optimize product pages for conversions (pricing, bundles, upsells)

 • Collaborate on ad scaling strategies (TikTok, Meta, etc.)

 • Improve AOV, conversion rate, and customer retention

 • Scale stores while maintaining profitability and stability



Analytics & Reporting

 • Track KPIs: ROAS, CPA, profit margins, refund rate, delivery time

 • Identify bottlenecks and growth opportunities

 • Provide regular performance reports and actionable insights



?



Requirements

 • Proven experience managing successful dropshipping stores

 • Strong understanding of Shopify, TikTok Shop, or similar platforms

 • Experience with private suppliers or fulfillment agents

 • Deep knowledge of disputes, chargebacks, and risk management

 • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

 • Ability to work independently and scale operations efficiently

title: LinkedIn Lead Generation Specialist
description:

We are building a high-performance LinkedIn outreach engine and want someone who is excited to own it. If you enjoy prospecting, starting conversations, and turning engagement into qualified opportunities, you will thrive here.



About the Role

We are not interested in spam or lazy automation. We want smart outreach, strong messaging, and someone who treats lead generation as a performance system.



What You’ll Be Doing

* Writing punchy, personalised outreach messages

* Running campaigns that feel human and intentional

* Managing conversations and nurturing leads

Experience in lead generation for the business advisory, coaching, or consulting industries



Compensation & Incentives



Salary is negotiable based on skills, experience, and demonstrated capability. Bonuses and performance incentives are available for the right candidate who consistently achieves agreed KPIs and objectives. We reward measurable impact and growth contribution.



Work Structure



* Full-time remote role

* Hours: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Sydney, Australia time

* Performance-focused culture with clear expectations



What Success Looks Like



* Consistent pipeline of qualified decision-makers

title: Marketing Virtual Assistant
description:
About CurbIT



CurbIT is an all natural GLP-1 support supplement designed to help individuals with healthy weight management and reduced cravings in a safe and clinically backed way. We are currently the only product online supported by a double-blind clinical study demonstrating a 544% increase in natural GLP-1 levels.



We are building credibility first, visibility second, and sales as a natural result of authority-driven content.



Role Overview

 presence from the ground up.



• This role is not just about posting content. The goal is to position CurbIT as a trusted, science-backed authority in the wellness space.



• The ideal candidate understands brand strategy, content marketing, and how to translate clinical data into engaging educational content.



Key Responsibilities

Brand Strategy and Positioning



• Extract and refine messaging from our website and clinical materials

• Develop clear content pillars focused on credibility, education, and wellness transformation

• Align all messaging with approved compliance and claims guidelines



Content Creation and Management



• Build and launch Instagram and
 brand presence

• Create educational posts, carousels, short-form videos, and captions

• Translate clinical study results into easy-to-understand content

• Develop authority driven posts around GLP-1 education and natural alternatives

• Schedule and manage consistent posting cadence



AI-Driven Marketing



• Use AI tools to research trends and expand brand visibility

• Repurpose content across platforms efficiently

• Identify opportunities to increase organic growth



Community and Brand Presence



• Monitor engagement and respond appropriately

• Help build a credible and professional online voice

• Support visibility growth while maintaining brand integrity



Reporting and Collaboration

• Present content direction and strategy for approval

• Provide simple performance insights and recommendations

• Work independently once direction is approved



Ideal Qualifications

• Experience building social media brands from zero

• Strong content strategy and storytelling skills

• Experience with health, wellness, or supplement brands preferred

• Comfortable interpreting and communicating scientific information

• Proficient with AI tools for marketing and content development

• Highly organized and self-directed



Working Style

• Founder approves overall direction and messaging

• VA executes strategy and manages day-to-day content



To Apply:

You MUST submit a portfolio of current social media work, a video intro, and a current resume. Must use at least 6 apply points.

title: Digital Marketer/Social Media Manager
description:
About the Role

Digital Orbit is a fast-growing U.S.-based marketing agency that works with premium brands in food, agriculture, and lifestyle. We are looking for a Social Media Coordinator who can manage content across multiple clients with strong attention to detail and a good eye for design. This role goes beyond scheduling posts. You will be responsible for creating content that matches each brand’s voice and visual standards while keeping calendars organized and ensuring everything we publish looks intentional and professional. There is clear opportunity for growth for someone who performs well and takes ownership.



Responsibilities

You will plan and schedule 4–6 posts per week for each brand using Metricool. Your role includes writing clear, natural captions that match each brand’s tone, creating high-quality branded graphics in Canva, and maintaining organized content calendars in Notion. You will also design and publish Stories, review posts for accuracy before publishing, monitor performance, and address any issues that arise. In addition, you will respond to comments and messages in the appropriate brand voice, assist with basic
 campaigns in Klaviyo or Mailchimp, and prepare monthly performance reports and simple marketing presentations.



Design Expectations

We expect clean, polished graphics that align with each brand’s identity. You should understand layout, typography, and visual hierarchy, and your work should feel custom and premium rather than template-based. Canva proficiency is required, and experience with Adobe tools is a plus. Designs should look thoughtful and brand-specific, not generic.



Tools You’ll Use

This role uses Canva or Adobe Suite, Notion, Metricool, Google Drive, Slack, and ChatGPT for brand-specific caption workflows. You may also work in Klaviyo or Mailchimp for
 campaigns.



Requirements

Candidates should have 3-6 years of experience in social media management or content creation, along with strong written English and communication skills. Attention to detail, strong organization, and the ability to manage multiple brands with different voices are essential. A Canva portfolio or relevant work samples are required. Experience with
 marketing or direct-to-consumer brands is a plus.



Schedule and Compensation

This is a full-time position (40 hours per week), Monday through Friday. You must be available for a few hours each day during U.S. Central Time. Compensation is based on experience, with performance-based bonuses available after the first 90 days.

title: Creative Video Editor: Documentary & Survival Style (Must be good with Stock Footage & AI)..
description:
We are looking for a Visual Storyteller, not just a "cutter."



We are building a channel in the Survival / History / Documentary niche. We do not need fancy transitions or flashy effects. We need ATMOSPHERE.



Your job is to take a voiceover script and turn it into a compelling visual experience using Stock Footage, Archival footage, and AI-generated images.



THE VISION (Must Watch): You must be able to replicate the editing style and pacing of these two channels. Please watch them before applying:



Style A (The Vibe): 
 (Raw, urgent, survival hacks, text overlays).



Style B (The Quality): 
 (Medieval Wisdom - Cinematic, ken burns effect, perfect stock matching).



The Hardest Part of This Job (Read Carefully): The script will say: "In 1930, families slept in freezing tents."



A bad editor puts a generic clip of a modern tent.



A GOOD editor (YOU) finds a black & white archival clip of a 1930s tent OR uses Midjourney/Leonardo.ai to GENERATE a specific image of a "sad family in a 1930s tent with snow."



Your Responsibilities:



Asset Hunting: You are a master at searching Storyblocks, MotionArray, Pexels, and Archives to find the perfect clip.



AI Generation: If you can't find the clip, you create it using AI (Midjourney/Leonardo).



Sound Design: You understand that sound is 50% of the video. You will add rain, wind, fire crackling, and city ambience to make the viewer feel the scene.



Visual Logic: You edit with your brain. If the narrator talks about "starvation," the visuals must look grim and hungry.



Requirements:



Proficiency in Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve.



Experience with AI Image Generators (Midjourney/Leonardo/DALL-E).



Great sense for "B-Roll" selection.



Good English (to understand the nuances of the script).



HOW TO APPLY (The Test): To prove you actually read this and watched the examples, please do the following:



Subject Line: "I can edit like OffGrid!"



Portfolio: Link your BEST video that is similar to the Documentary/Survival style. (Do not send gaming montages or vlogs).



The Question: Look at the Off Grid Solutions channel link above. Tell me in 1-2 sentences: What makes their editing effective for retention? (Is it the sound? The text? The stock footage?).



Applications without the correct subject line will be ignored...

title: Real Estate Disposition Mgr. Virtual
description:
Disposition Manager (Virtual)

Real Estate Investment Company - New York

About the Role

We're seeking a detail-oriented, relationship-focused professional to manage our buyer pipeline and disposition process. This is a systems-driven role where your success comes from consistent follow-up, meticulous documentation, and nurturing buyer relationships over time. You'll be the organized backbone of our disposition operation - not the negotiator (our CEO handles that), but the person who makes sure nothing falls through the cracks.

If you thrive on process, organization, and building long-term relationships rather than high-pressure sales, this role is for you.



What You'll Actually Do Every Day

Buyer Pipeline Management (50% of your time)



Respond to buyer inquiries via phone,
, and text within established timeframes

Nurture relationships with prospective buyers through consistent, friendly follow-up

Maintain detailed buyer profiles in our CRM (preferences, budget, timeline, communication style)

Track buyer activity and engagement to identify who's ready to move forward

Schedule property showings and coordinate logistics



Marketing & Property Posting (25% of your time)



Post new properties to Investorlift and marketing channels following our templates

Execute
 campaigns via GHL to targeted buyer segments

Manage text blast campaigns to buyer lists

Maintain property marketing materials and ensure all listings are current

Monitor and respond to social media inquiries



Documentation & CRM Management (20% of your time)



Document all buyer interactions, offers, and property interest in Podio CRM

Maintain organized records of contract assignments and JV agreements

Update pipeline status daily so leadership has real-time visibility

Generate weekly reports on buyer activity and deal flow

Ensure data accuracy and completeness across all systems



Relationship Building (5% of your time)



Build rapport with repeat buyers and investor clients

Support realtor relationships through timely communication

Identify and flag potential off-market deal opportunities from your buyer conversations





What Makes Someone Great at This Role

You're naturally organized and detail-oriented



You love systems, checklists, and keeping things documented

Nothing slips through the cracks on your watch

You take pride in a clean, up-to-date CRM



You're patient and consistent



You understand that buyers move at different speeds

You don't mind following up with the same person multiple times over weeks/months

You find satisfaction in the steady, reliable execution of your follow-up process



You're warm and professional on the phone



You build rapport naturally without being pushy

You're a good listener who remembers details about people

You make buyers feel supported, not pressured



You're comfortable with technology



You pick up new software quickly (CRM,
 marketing, MLS platforms)

You're proficient in Google Suite and MS Office

You see technology as a tool that makes your work easier, not a barrier



You thrive with clear processes



You like knowing exactly what's expected and when

You follow procedures reliably

You're comfortable with structure and repetition





What This Role Is NOT

This is not a high-pressure sales or negotiation role. We have deal-makers for that. This role is about:



Nurturing, not closing

Documenting, not negotiating

Following up consistently, not chasing quick wins

Building systems and relationships, not cutting deals



If you're someone who gets bored with repetitive tasks, needs constant variety, or wants to be the deal closer - this isn't the right fit.



Requirements

Experience:



1-3 years in real estate coordination, sales support, customer service, or CRM management

MLS, Inivestorlift familiarity preferred (we'll train if you have strong tech skills)

Experience with Podio CRM is a plus, but not required



Technical Skills:



Proficient in Google Suite (Gmail, Sheets, Docs) 

Comfortable learning new marketing tools (Investorlift, MLS, MailChimp, text platforms)

Quick learner with technology



Communication Skills:



Strong written and verbal communication

Professional phone presence

Ability to build rapport with diverse personalities



Work Style:



Self-motivated and reliable (this is a virtual role)

Excellent organizational and time management skills

Comfortable working independently with clear processes

Available for occasional evening/weekend buyer inquiries





Compensation & Details



Position Type: Full-time, Virtual/Remote

Location: Must be available during NY business hours

Compensation: $5.00 per hour based on experience, plus bonuses for closed assignments 

Growth Path: Opportunity to grow into senior disposition coordination or asset management support roles





How to Apply

If you're someone who finds satisfaction in organized systems, consistent execution, and building long-term relationships, we want to hear from you.

Please submit:



Your resume

A brief note (3-5 sentences) explaining why process-oriented, detail-focused work energizes you rather than drains you

Video applicants will be prioritized 



Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We'll conduct phone screens before any in-person interviews to ensure mutual fit.

 & Ash Mill Insurance: High-volume insurance funnels (Paid Ads -> Landing Page -> SMS Nurture).

  - Bind Bros LLC: A B2B consulting funnel selling "Business-in-a-Box" setups. You will build Master Snapshots of our insurance funnels that we can "one-click" deploy for consulting clients using Custom Values and automated onboarding.



WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  - Architecture & Productization: Set up 3 Sub-Accounts and build "template-ready" Snapshots. You must ensure logos, links, and phone numbers update automatically via Custom Values when we deploy a new client.

  - Funnel & Automation Mastery: Build high-converting, premium-looking landing pages (CSS knowledge is a plus). Configure complex "Speed-to-Lead" workflows (Missed Call Text Back, Fast-Five Nurtures).

  - Technical Stack: Handle A2P 10DLC registration (Critical), configure Power Dialers, and integrate Stripe for automated service delivery.

  - Ad Tracking: Connect
 Lead Forms and Google Conversion API (CAPI) to ensure 1:1 attribution for our ad spend.



REQUIREMENTS (MUST HAVE):

  - 3+ Years Deep GHL Experience: You have built Snapshots from scratch and mastered the Workflow builder.

  - Insurance Industry Expertise: You speak the language (Quotes, Bind, Dec Pages, X-Dates).

  - Compliance & Tracking: Proven success with A2P 10DLC registration and UTM/CAPI ad attribution.

  - SaaS/Consulting Logic: You understand the B2B user journey, from booking an appointment to automated contract delivery.



BENEFITS AND PAY:

- Salary: 100,000 PHP - 120,000 PHP / Month (Depending on experience).

- Schedule: Full-Time, US Business Hours (EST).

- Long-term contract or position.



HOW TO APPLY

To be considered, submit your Portfolio/CV and a link to short video (Loom or similar, 3-5 minutes)



In your video, please include:

  - Show us the "Under the Hood" logic of a complex Insurance Funnel or Workflow you built.

  - Explain your "X-Date" strategy: How do you automate a re-engagement workflow for a prospect whose policy expires in 6 months?

  - Explain your "Friction" strategy: How do you capture a phone number before asking deep underwriting questions (like VINs)? Mention if you have used Canopy Connect.



In the text of your application, please provide:

  - What is one "hidden" reason A2P 10DLC Brand Registration gets rejected for insurance agencies, and how do you prevent it?

- Put the word 'ARCHITECT' at the very top of your application so I know you read this entire post.

title: Founder's Personal Assistant
description:
Role: Founder’s Personal & Executive Assistant



Location: Remote (Philippines)

About the Role



We are looking for a highly capable Founder’s Personal & Executive Assistant to support the founder of a fast-growing, US-based technology startup.



This role blends executive assistance, business coordination, light content support, and personal assistance. The ideal candidate helps keep the founder focused and operating at a high level — while also supporting external communication and presence.



Experience supporting technology, SaaS, or AI companies is strongly preferred.



This is a long-term role with room to grow.



?



Key Responsibilities



Executive & Personal Support

 • Manage calendars, scheduling, and coordination across time zones (primarily Pacific Time)

 • Coordinate meetings with internal teams, external partners, and advisors

 • Draft, organize, and manage professional
 communication

 • Assist with travel planning, itineraries, and logistics

 • Track reminders, priorities, and follow-ups to ensure nothing drops



?



Business & Coordination Support

 • Prepare meeting agendas, summaries, and follow-ups

?



Social & Ghostwriting Support (Important, but not primary)

 • LinkedIn posts

 threads or replies

(This is not a full-time content role — judgment, clarity, and tone matter more than volume.)



?



Requirements



Must-Have

 • Bachelor’s degree (any discipline)

 • Excellent written and spoken English

 • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

 • Availability during US Pacific Time hours

 • Professional discretion and confidentiality

 • Ability to work independently and anticipate needs



?



Preferred Qualifications

 • Experience supporting founders or executives at tech, SaaS, or AI companies

 • Prior exposure to social media ghostwriting, especially LinkedIn and X

 • Familiarity with founder-style writing (opinionated, concise, professional)

 • Comfort with US business culture and professional communication

 • Experience working with US-based clients or teams



?



Tools & Systems

 • Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Docs)

 • Slack / WhatsApp

 • LinkedIn and X 
)

 • Task/document tools (Notion, spreadsheets)

?



What Success Looks Like

 • The founder’s schedule runs smoothly and predictably

 • Communication is clear, timely, and professional

 • Social posts reflect the founder’s voice and thinking

 • Tasks are handled proactively with minimal oversight

 • The assistant feels like a trusted extension of the founder



?



Working Style & Culture

 • Remote-first, professional, and fast-moving

 • Clear expectations and direct feedback

 • High trust, high accountability

 • Long-term collaboration mindset

title: Junior Video Editor (Paid Ads)
description:
About the Role:

We’re an eCommerce brand that is expanding globally.



This role is primarily a video editing role focused on producing short-form ad creatives for platforms like
. You’ll work from clear direction and examples, while also helping prepare simple ad briefs so editors and media buyers stay aligned.



This is an execution-first role with light creative input. You don’t need to be a strategist, but you should understand why ads are structured the way they are.





What You’ll Do

- Edit short-form video ads (UGC, product clips, simple statics)

- Assemble ads using provided scripts, briefs, and references

- Add basic text overlays, captions, cuts, and pacing for ads

- Create simple variations from the same core footage

- Help document ad structure in basic ad briefs (hook, message, CTA)

- Make revisions based on internal feedback

- Organize files and exports clearly for the team

- Attend weekly internal check-ins





What We’re Looking For



Required

- Basic video editing skills (CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar)

- Comfortable editing short-form videos (15–60 seconds)

- Clear written English

- Able to follow instructions and meet deadlines

- Open to feedback and revisions

- Organized and reliable



Nice to Have (Not Required)

- Experience editing ads or UGC-style content

- Familiarity with
 or 
 ads

- Basic understanding of hooks, captions, and CTAs

- Experience working with Google Drive or Notion





Training & Growth



You’ll be trained on:

- Our ad structures and creative standards

- How to edit for performance (not aesthetics)

- How ad briefs are used to guide creative



There is room to grow into a Creative Producer or Creative Strategist role over time, based on performance.





This Role Is For You If:

- You enjoy editing videos and improving pacing

- You want to learn how ads actually work

- You’re detail-oriented and coachable

- You like structured work with clear direction



This Role Is Not For You If

- You want full creative freedom immediately

- You dislike revisions or fast turnarounds

- You’re looking for a senior editing or strategy role





How to Apply



Please send:

1. A short intro video about yourself 

2. A portfolio or samples of video edits (ads preferred, but not required)

3. The editing tools you use

title: Full-time Virtual Assistant (Real Estate Support)
description:
We’re hiring: Full-time Virtual Assistant (Real Estate Support)

Remote | Singapore Time zone (SGT)

Job Overview

We are hiring a Full-Time Assistant (Real Estate Support) to join me at a Singapore-based real estate business. You’ll play a crucial role in supporting admins tasks and client operations and communications. This role is ideal for an experienced VA who is highly organised, detail-oriented, and familiar with property-related marketing tasks. You’ll directly with me on a daily basis. 

You will work remotely from the Philippines and support daily real estate operations, listings management, client coordination, and marketing administration.

 

Key Responsibilities

• Assist with property listings (PropertyGuru, 99.co, internal platforms)

• Prepare and update listing descriptions, floor plans, and photo folders

• Shortlist properties and list them out

• Update CRM, lead trackers, and enquiry logs

• Transaction submissions

• Prepare basic marketing materials (listing write-ups, simple Canva designs, PDFs)

• 

• Organise property documents (OTPs, tenancy agreements, inventories, checklists)

• Support day-to-day administrative and operational tasks for the real estate consultant

• Handle any ad-hoc admin duties as required.

 

Working Hours

• Monday to Friday 9am – 6pm SGT (1 hour lunch break at 1pm)

• Sat & Sun: Standby 11am – 5pm (as needed)

• Workload is generally light on weekends but you must be reachable.

• Singapore Time (SGT) working hours

• Flexibility required during peak listing or launch periods

 

Required Skills & Experience

• Based in the Philippines with stable internet and a quiet working environment

• Prior experience as a Real Estate / Property VA is a plus

• Good written and spoken English

• Detail-oriented and consistent 

• Tech-savvy (familiar with Google Workspace, WhatsApp Web, Basic Canva)

• Strong visual and aesthetic sense for PDF presentation design

• Good understanding of layout, spacing, typography, and colour coordination

• Ability to produce clean, client-ready presentation decks

• Independent but know when to ask for help 

• Comfortable using ChatGPT/Google/AI to solve problems

• Committed to showing up on time and being reliable evry day

• Highly organised, reliable, and responsive

• Hungry to learn and grow – I’m happy to teach but won’t micromanage

 

Salary & Benefits

• Competitive monthly salary based on experience (800-1200/mth)

• Paid monthly via WISE or DBS Remit 

• Stable full-time engagement

• Paid public holidays (to be discussed)

• Long-term opportunity with performance-based increments

 

How to Apply

Please submit:

1. Your resume

2. A short introduction highlighting your real estate or property VA experience

3. Your internet speed and home setup

4. Your expected monthly salary (PHP)

Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a simple trial task.

 

Why Join Us

• Clear systems and structured workflows

• Professional, respectful working environment

• Long-term role (not a short-term gig)

• Opportunity to grow with a fast-moving real estate business

• Attractive bonus incentives will be provided based on performance and contribution.

*Interested candidates may apply by submitting their resume and a brief introduction highlighting relevant experience.

*Shortlisted candidates may be asked to design a simple 2–3 page PDF presentation to demonstrate layout and aesthetic sense.

title: Real Estate Media & Marketing Agency Virtual Assistant
description:
Salary: $1,000 per month

Schedule: Full Time, Remote



We are a fast growing real estate media and marketing agency working with real estate professionals, business owners, and personal brands. We are looking for a reliable, detail oriented Virtual Assistant to support our operations and help keep projects moving smoothly behind the scenes.



This role is ideal for someone organized, proactive, and comfortable following systems and SOPs. You will work closely with our Operations Lead and team as a second VA, supporting daily tasks across clients, editors, and social media projects.



What You’ll Be Helping With



You will follow step by step SOPs and training for tasks such as:



Project & Task Support



• Updating Trello boards and task statuses

• Tracking deadlines and making sure nothing falls behind

• Organizing project folders and files



Client & Team Communication



• Sending follow up messages to clients or editors

• Relaying updates between tea
mbers

• Keeping communication organized in Slack and



Real Estate Media Support



• Organizing photo and video files from property shoots

• Assisting with delivery tracking and revisions

• Supporting coordination between photographers, editors, and clients

• Reviewing media for quality control before client delivery



Photo Editing & Quality Control



• Light editing of real estate photos using Lightroom

• Basic retouching and corrections using Photoshop

• Ensuring color balance, exposure, alignment, and consistency

• Catching technical issues such as distortion, cropping errors, misalignment, or missed edits

• Maintaining a high standard of visual quality before files are sent to clients



A strong eye for detail and visual quality is required. You must be comfortable using Lightroom for light editing and Photoshop for minor adjustments.



Social Media Support



• Uploading captions and media into scheduling tools

• Checking that posts are scheduled correctly

• Organizing content folders for different accounts



Admin & System Tasks



• Data entry and organizing information

• Updating spreadsheets and internal trackers

• Keeping internal systems clean and up to date



You will not be expected to know everything right away. We provide SOPs, checklists, and examples for most tasks, and you will be working under guidance supporting our main operations lead.



Requirements



• Strong written English

• Highly organized and detail oriented

• Strong eye for photo quality and visual consistency

• Experience using Lightroom for light editing

• Basic working knowledge of Photoshop

• Comfortable using tools like Google Drive, Trello, Slack, and Dropbox

• Able to follow instructions and SOPs carefully

• Reliable internet and computer

• Able to work full time hours consistently



Nice to Have (Not Required)



• Experience as a VA, project assistant, or social media assistant

• Familiarity with social media platforms (Instagram,
, TikTok)

• Experience supporting creative, marketing, or real estate teams



How to Apply



Please include:

	1.	A short introduction about yourself

	2.	Your previous VA or admin experience

	3.	Your experience with Lightroom and Photoshop

	4.	The tools you have used before (Trello, Slack, Google Drive, etc.)

	5.	Your internet speed

	6.	The word “ORGANIZED” in your application so we know you read this post



We are looking for someone long term who wants to grow with the team. If you are dependable, proactive, detail oriented, and have a strong eye for quality, we would love to meet you.

title: Full Time Photo & Video Editor for Real Estate Media Agency
description:
We are a growing real estate media and marketing agency looking for a full time photo and video editor to join our team long term.



This is a production focused role for someone fast, consistent, and detail oriented. You will be editing real estate photos, short form videos, and marketing content for agents, businesses, and personal brands.







Compensation Structure



This is a full time position with a target monthly earning of around $1,200, based on consistent output.



Pay is calculated per project:



Photo Editing

• $0.25 to $0.50 per photo

Rate depends on complexity and type of edit



Video Editing Rates



• Basic Trimming – $5

Simple cuts and clean up



• Entertainment Style / Highlight Edits – $8

Fast paced, engaging edits with music and strong pacing



• Talking Head Videos with Captions – $15

60 to 90 second videos with captions and clean pacing



• Longer Form Videos – $35

3 to 5 minute videos with structure, pacing, b roll, music, and polish



You will receive clear editing guides and references for each style. Editors who can handle volume efficiently and maintain quality can reach the target monthly pay.







What You’ll Be Editing



Real Estate Photo Editing

• Exposure and color correction

• Window pulls

• Sky replacements

• Basic retouching



Video Editing

• Talking head videos

• Reels and highlight videos

• Basic trims and longer form content

• Matching our brand editing style



Raw files will be delivered via Dropbox, and finished edits will be submitted through our workflow system.







Requirements



• Strong experience in photo editing

• Strong experience in video editing

• Able to follow editing guides and match style references

• Fast turnaround times

• Reliable internet for large file transfers

• Detail oriented and consistent







Nice to Have



• Real estate editing experience

• Experience editing for social media

• Familiar with Dropbox and 







How to Apply



Please include:

 1. A short intro about yourself

 2. Your photo editing portfolio

 3. Your video editing portfolio

 4. What editing software you use

 5. Your average turnaround time

 6. The word EDIT PRO in your application



We are looking for someone dependable who wants steady, long term work and can grow with our team.

title: Intermediate Accountant – NZ Tax Compliance & Year-End Accounts (WFH)
description:
About the role

We are a New Zealand–based Chartered Accounting firm seeking an experienced Intermediate Accountant to join our established compliance team in the Philippines.

This is a long-term contract role offering stable hours and a lasting working relationship with our NZ team. You’ll support NZ SME clients and trusts, working closely with colleagues across borders to deliver accurate, timely compliance work.



Work details

• Location: Work from home

• Schedule: 6:00am – 3:00pm PHT (8 hours)

• Engagement type: Long-term contract role (full-time)

• Start date: March 2026



Key Responsibilities

•  Prepare NZ annual financial statements and income tax returns (individuals, companies, partnerships, trusts)

• Prepare and review GST returns and related reconciliations

•  Build and reconcile Xero Workpapers with clear supporting documentation

•  Review junior accountants’ work and provide constructive feedback

•  Respond to client queries and explain tax positions in clear, practical terms

•  Follow workflow processes using FYI Docs and XPM

•  Identify opportunities to improve templates, checklists, and processes



Skills & Experience

This role is best suited to someone with 3–5 years’ NZ public practice experience.



Required:

• Strong NZ income tax and GST compliance experience

• Hands-on experience with Xero and Xero Workpapers

•  Experience with reconciliations (bank, GST, fixed assets, imputation credits)

•  Understanding of NZ Trust structures and beneficiary allocations

• Solid knowledge of NZ tax and IRD/myIR processes

•  Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple deadlines



Nice to have

• Experience reviewing and coaching junior staff

• Experience with FYI Docs and XPM



Qualifications

• Bachelor of Science in Accountancy (preferred)

• CPA pathway or equivalent (preferred)



Tools You’ll Use

Xero, Xero Workpapers, FYI Docs, XPM, myIR, Microsoft 365



What We Offer

•  Competitive market-rate compensation, based on experience

•  Long-term, full-time, stable contract role with an established NZ firm

•  Work-from-home setup with laptop and modern tools provided

•  Support for professional development and CPD

• Collaborative team environment with clear processes



To apply:

Send your CV and a brief summary of your NZ accounting experience to 



Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next step.

title: EA for E-Commerce and Software Entrepreneur
description:
You would be helping a busy entrepreneur that runs two different operations. 



The first operation you'd be helping him build out and expanding his new peptide and health company.  

You would be helping him manage the building of the operation of selling peptides, supplements and other health-related products. 



Your day to day would be assisting in the following processes.  We don't expect an expert in any of these tasks, we are building them out, so you would be assisting in some capacity with researching, building out processes, and assisting in the each or all of these responsibilities:

- Assisting in the sourcing and research of peptides, supplements, and other products.

- Tracking and researching the best way for importing, and dealing with importing agents for different countries.

- Tracking and researching testing of peptides and making sure that there is a system from once peptides are ordered and imported, that they go to the testing facility/lab that show the purity of the products.

- Helping upload the certificates received from the testing facilities/labs that show the purity of the products.

- Managing the inventory process - loading, tracking, reordering.

- Researching the labeling of products.

- Managing of the sale of the products, namely peptides, products, and courses. 

- Managing the uploading of content of their blogposts, podcasts, social media posts (FB, X, Instagram, TikTok, WhatsApp)

- Overseeing orders were being processed correctly via payment gateways, Venmo, crypto, PayPal, and other means.   

- Overseeing the buildout of lists to contact clinics and med spas.

- Overseeing the outreach and marketing and sale of health products to clinics, med spas, or consumers. 

- Managing any inquiries, complaints, issues, etc.

title: Provider Success Specialist
description:
About Puurk!

Puurk lets med spas and similar businesses build and run their own payment plans rather than sending clients to a third-party lender. During consultations, providers show two prices—one for paying in full and one for paying over several months. They d
 how much to collect up front and how long the plan runs, keep the entire premium because Puurk isn’t a lender, and rely on Puurk’s software to calculate payments, automate collections and deposit revenue directly into the business. Showing monthly pricing up front helps remove sticker shock; according to Puurk, more patients say yes and treatment plans often become larger.



What We're Hiring For:

We’re hiring a Provider Success Specialist to support and guide our Providers (med spas, clinics, and other service businesses). 



Big Picture

A Provider Success Specialist makes sure Providers use Puurk effectively and quickly.  The more Providers use Puurk, the more successful they become--so the main goal of a Provider Success Specialist is to get Providers using and loving Puurk! 



Roles and Day-to-Day Tasks:

As a Provider Success Specialist (PSS) your role and day-to-day tasks will be:



Provider Account Onboarding and Set Up

- Guide Providers through their Puurk account set up and management. 

- Teach Providers how to upload their services and products, and complete their Puurk account.  

- Confirm all information is right in the Provider's profile, such as setting Tips, Sales Tax.

- Assist with adding and connecting Users (staff and management) for the Provider.

- Assist Providers with uploading Clients.

- Assist and guide Providers in creating their first Offer (treatment plan).



Provider Training and Follow Up

- Follow up and maintain contact with all Providers.  

- Check in and see how they are liking Puurk, where they are using it, how they are using it.  

- Encourage Providers to use Puurk as often as possible.

- Share words of understanding, optimism and support.

- Be cheerful and warm.



Continue Training Providers and Staff on How to Use and Introduce Puurk

- Directing them to Puurk's online trainings and manuals, as well as through answering questions via text,
, calls, or creating short Loom how-to videos.  

-Help Provider's front-desk teams, clinicians and administrators know how to introduce Puurk to their Clients, and how to operate Puurk on an ongoing basis. 



Continue Contact via Support and Check-In's

- Stays eternally upbeat, sending cheerful reminders, celebrating wins and issuing mini-challenges to keep Puurk usage high.  

(This is a big transition for most Providers from simply taking a payment, to taking payment over time, so there is quite a bit of hand-holding during this adoption period).  



Support, Support, and More Support

Be the always-friendly, always-upbeat point of contact 

- Handle questions and issues about Clients, Contracts 

- Pass billing or collections to the Billing and Collections Specialists

 (Success is measured by how quickly Providers are onboarded and how quickly they and their staff use Puurk.  The more they use Puurk, the more likely Providers will get into the habit and make it core to their business and continue to use it.)



We’re looking for someone who is super positive, bubbly, but helpful and professional 

(You’ll be texting,
ing, and calling Providers regularly.)

title: GoHighLevel Admin / Systems Architect – Turn 1 License Into a Money?Making Department
description:
We’re looking for a self?driven **GoHighLevel (GHL) admin** who doesn’t just “run” the platform—they *weaponize* it. If you live in the backend, think in funnels, automate everything that can be automated, and naturally engineer high?converting systems without waiting to be told what to do, this is your spot.



### **The Role**

You’ll own our **single GoHighLevel license** as its own profit center—an entire money?making department inside the agency. You’ll:

- Build, scale, and optimize full?stack client systems: funnels, automations, text/email campaigns, SMS, calendars, and business workflows.

- Architect GoHighLevel stacks that close leads, reduce friction, and increase LTV for local service businesses.

- Use your own creativity—not canned templates—to design unique, high?performance campaigns that actually sell.

- Audit, streamline, and systemize existing client setups so we can clone what works across clients.

- Work with minimal oversight: you’ll be trusted to steer the ship, make decisions, and own the results.



### **What We’re Looking For**

- Proven, hands?on experience as a **GoHighLevel admin, operator, or systems architect**.

- Deep understanding of funnel psychology and how back?end systems drive front?end sales.

- You don’t wait for a “brief” or “creative brief”—you *are* the creative and the architect.

- Strong organizational sense and ability to document systems so others can scale them.

- Comfortable working asynchronously with minimal micromanagement.

- Bonus if you have experience with:

  - Local service businesses (HVAC, roofing, solar, contractors, etc.)

  - White?label agency setups

  - Lead?gen funnels, SMS nurturing, and calendar?based conversion workflows.



### **What You’re Not**

- You’re not just a “click?around” admin.

title: EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT – Communications & Outreach (Property Management Company) [REMOTE]
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We’re a close, family-like U.S. long-term rental company looking for a sharp, resourceful, people-savvy Executive Assistant to support day-to-day operations. We’re hiring someone with proven, long-term professional experience — in any field. This is NOT an entry-level position.



We’ll train you on the “what” — but we need you to bring the “how.” That means:

**Thinking on your feet

**Solving problems before they escalate

**Speaking English clearly and confidently on the phone

**Caring about the business like it’s your own



We value people who treat the business like they’re part of it — not just clocking hours. If you’re the kind of person who goes the extra mile because you take pride in doing great work, you’ll thrive here.



**WHAT YOU’LL ACTUALLY DO**

• Be a reliable, professional point of contact for current tenants

• Manage lease renewals and ongoing tenant communication

• Make phone calls to gather info, follow up, and resolve issues

• Coordinate tasks, track details, and prevent things from falling through the cracks

• Help solve problems independently — and escalate only when needed

• Keep the owner organized and focused



-> This is not a checklist-following job. It’s a *thinking* role for someone who can move fast, stay calm, and figure things out.



**WHO THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR**

• *You speak clearly, confidently, and professionally in English — especially on calls*

• You’re a natural problem solver who can handle unexpected challenges without panic

• You think fast, take initiative, and don’t need hand-holding

• You genuinely care about the quality of your work and the business you’re supporting

• You’re someone who prepares, researches, and shows up ready

• You value long-term stability and being part of a trusted team



This is Remote (Work from Home – must have reliable computer & internet)

Full-time (40 hrs/week) | Independent Contractor



-> No property management or sales experience required

-> *Training provided — but success in this role depends on your ability to communicate smoothly and handle live conversations with clarity and confidence*



**WORK SCHEDULE**

• Full-time (40 hours/week)

• You choose your exact working hours, but must be reachable and responsive during U.S. Pacific Time business hours (7 AM – 7 PM, Mon–Fri), with active work occurring within that window



**COMPENSATION & GROWTH**

*Base pay up to $800/month to start,* with performance-based increases and bonuses for reliability, initiative, and strong work ethic.

Long-term role with real stability — no short-term rentals, no Airbnb chaos

Direct collaboration with the business owner — your work will actually make a difference



**FROM A CURRENT TEA
MBER**

“Working with Heavenly Happy Homes over the past year has been an experience I am truly blessed and grateful for. It has indeed been life-changing. From the very beginning, I felt trusted, supported, and encouraged to do my best. That kind of environment makes a huge difference, especially when working remotely. After going through uncertainty in a previous role, I was really praying to find a company where I could grow, learn, and feel secure long-term. Heavenly Happy Homes turned out to be exactly that and more. You genuinely find yourself loving the company and sincerely caring about the work you do. The culture here is respectful and collaborative, and everyone truly wants to see each other succeed. Even as a remote team, there is a strong sense of teamwork and shared purpose, which I honestly love. Training is efficient and well guided. R.S. helped me a lot, especially in understanding processes clearly. Another thing I can sincerely say is that hard work here never goes unnoticed. It is always valued and genuinely appreciated. Our boss is truly a wonderful employer!”



**HOW TO APPLY**

Submit your application here: 

Applications through OLJ may not be considered. Please complete the application at the link in this post.

title: Short-Form Viral Content Research VA (IG Reels & TikTok)
description:
I’m looking for a detail-oriented and trend-savvy Virtual Assistant to research high-performing short-form videos on Instagram Reels and TikTok in the designer reps niche.

Your main task will be to find 100 viral short-form videos that performed exceptionally well and can be easily reproduced for my own Instagram store content.

This is research only - no video editing or posting required.



Main Responsibilities:

- Research Instagram Reels and TikTok content in the designer reps niche



Find 100 short-form videos that:

- Have 100k–2M+ views

- Went viral within the last 2-10 months

- Are realistic to recreate

- Collect and organize data in Google Sheets or Notion









What Makes a Video “Good” for This Job

- The videos you find must be designed to maximize watch time and rewatches.

I’m looking for two types of videos, with a specific ratio:



1) Pain-Driven + CTA-Friendly Videos (?60%)



These videos should reveal a clear pain point early (first 1–3 seconds), for example:

- “You want to buy designer reps but don’t know where”

- “Why most people get bad-quality reps”

- “Buying reps on your own is risky”



Show:

- The process of trying to do it yourself

- Why it’s confusing, risky, or time-consuming



Naturally allow space for:

- A CTA

- A lead magnet

- My service as the solution (access to top-tier factories, avoiding scams, saving time, etc.)



These videos should also include retention elements, such as:

- “Wait till the end” style structure

- Step-by-step reveals

- Before vs after

- Mistake-based formats (“Don’t do this…”)



2) Entertainment / High-Retention Videos (?40%)



These videos don’t need to push a direct pain point but must keep people watching till the end or rewatching. Good examples include:

- Lists (e.g. “Top 5 reps mistakes people make”)

- VS / Comparison videos (cheap vs top-tier, expectation vs reality)

- Ranking or rating formats

- Reveal-at-the-end videos

- Visually satisfying or entertaining formats

- POV or reaction-style content that encourages rewatches



These videos should:

- Be easy to recreate

- Be relevant to the designer reps niche

- Still allow for a soft CTA or branding (even if indirect)









Important Notes for Research



You do NOT need to write the CTA or script

Your job is to identify videos where:



- People are likely to watch till the end

- People may rewatch

- The structure clearly works for short-form platforms



When in doubt, ask yourself:

“Would this video make someone curious enough to finish it?”









This is a paid test project. The goal is to identify someone who can consistently find high-retention, viral-ready content ideas.

If your research directly helps my content perform well, you will be offered ongoing or full-time work.
