title: Senior Australian Bookkeeper (Xero | Payroll | Work from Home | Day Shift)
description:
We’re expanding internationally and are seeking a smart, detail-focused bookkeeper to manage financial operations across multiple entities with precision and efficiency.



About the Role



You will manage one Australian entitty and one small NZ entity, handling bookkeeping, payroll, reporting, and reconciliation.

This is a senior-level position — we’re looking for someone who can own the numbers, spot discrepancies instantly, and work closely with leadership to ensure clean, accurate financial data.



Key Responsibilities



Prepare monthly or quarterly cash flow / health indicator reports

Reconcile loan accounts and balance sheet items

Produce weekly/monthly performance reports for directors

Handle ad hoc accounting analysis and reporting tasks



Ongoing Responsibilities

Manage fortnightly and monthly payroll across 2 Australian entities (occasionally NZ payroll)

Handle Australian payroll compliance (superannuation, maternity leave, PAYG, STP, leave tracking)

Prepare BAS/IAS

Maintain accurate contracts, commission and bonus records (training provided)

Oversee accounts payable and receivable, ensuring timeliness and compliance

Prepare and lodge monthly state payroll tax

Onboard new staff in Xero and payroll systems

Perform daily and weekly bank and credit card reconciliations

Control and reconcile petty cash and reimbursements

Support credit control and monitor payment plans

Maintain daily cashflow reports, support budgeting and forecasting

Provide financial and reporting support to management as needed

Manage small NZ entity accounts (low volume)



Tools You’ll Use



Xero (Advanced User) – multiple entities, payroll, bank rules, tracking

eWay & WooCommerce (bonus) – reconciliation and payment tracking

Google Sheets / Excel – reporting and analysis

Slack / Asana / Pipedrive – communication and coordination

Deputy HR



Who You Are



5+ years’ Australian bookkeeping or accounting experience

Advanced Xero proficiency (multiple entities and payroll)

Excellent understanding of Australian accounting & payroll compliance

Strong attention to detail — you don’t miss a single cent

Excellent written and spoken English (clear, professional, neutral accent)

Proactive, solution-focused, and able to work independently

Confident communicating with directors and accountants

Highly organised, methodical, and reliable — “gets it done”

Bonus: Experience reconciling eWay, WooCommerce, or similar



Why You’ll Love Working With Us



Stable, long-term role with a growing Australian company

Supportive and respectful culture — we value, empathy accuracy and initiative

Work alongside leadership and learn the financial structure of multiple businesses

Flexible environment — quality and ownership matter most



How to Apply

Your experience with Australian bookkeeping & payroll

title: Outreach & Lead Generation Specialist (IG + Email) – Premium Clients
description:
We’re AMC Strategic Media (Romania). We help premium businesses grow with short-form content (luxury documentary style + retention).



TARGET MARKETS

Primary: Romania + EU + UK

Secondary (later): USA / Australia



INDUSTRIES

Real Estate Developers, Premium Restaurants/Fine Dining, Clinics (Dental/Aesthetic), Hotels, High-end local services.



YOUR MISSION

Build lead lists + send outreach + follow-ups + book calls with decision makers.



DAILY TASKS

- Build lead lists (business name + city + IG +
/website + decision maker if available)

- Send 100 messages/day using our system:

  • 93 bulk messages (fast, scalable)

  • 7 “sniper” messages (highly personalized to top targets)

- Follow-ups at +24h and +72h

- Track everything in Google Sheets (Status: Sent / Reply / Follow-up 1 / Follow-up 2 / Booked Call)



IMPORTANT (ABOUT PORTFOLIO/DEMO)

We don’t always send a portfolio in the first message. Your first goal is to start conversations and identify decision makers.

When our demo is ready, you will include the demo link in follow-ups and warm leads.



WHAT “SNIPER” MEANS

A sniper message is NOT a video. It’s a short, highly personalized DM/email based on 1–2 minutes of research

(last post/reel, offer, city, project, etc.) to increase reply rate with top targets.



KPI (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

- 100 total messages/day, 5 days/week (recommended: 60 new + 40 follow-ups)

- Minimum 20 follow-ups/day

- Sheet updated daily (no gaps)



REQUIREMENTS

- Strong English writing (short, clear, non-spammy)

- Organized and consistent

- Comfortable with rejection

- Outreach/Lead gen experience is a plus



PAY

$300–$500/month (based on experience)

+ Bonus per booked call

+ Bonus per closed deal



HOW TO APPLY (MANDATORY – IF YOU SKIP THIS, WE WILL PASS)

Reply with:

1) A 5-line IG DM for a premium restaurant in Bucharest

2) A 5-line IG DM for a real estate developer in Romania

3) A 5-line “sniper” DM for a real estate developer (show personalization in the first line)

4) Confirm you can hit 100 msgs/day and track in Google Sheets

5) Your monthly rate + weekly availability

title: IT Business Analyst (Philippines Only)
description:
You may apply using this link:  



About Us



Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate agents across the country. We are seeking an outgoing, tech savvy individual to join our growing team.



 



Why work for Ylopo?



At Ylopo we offer tea
mbers:



a commitment to personal development,



guidance and support at a high level through interfacing with our Executive Team to prioritize goals as a company,



excellent leadership and mentoring for our entry-level to senior staff, and recognition of outstanding efforts,



team building events, team lunches/ happy hours, and other company wide events



a supportive, caring environment dedicated to continuous learning and growth.



Ylopo is seeking a sharp, solutions-driven IT Business Analyst to help transform business needs into clear, actionable requirements. If you're passionate about documentation, testing, and process optimization, and thrive in collaborative, fast-paced environments, this is your chance to make an impact. Work closely with developers and stakeholders to drive clarity, alignment, and continuous improvement across our projects.



Job Description:



Gather, document, and validate business requirements by eliciting, analyzing, and specifying the underlying business needs and compiling them into a Business Requirement Document (BRD).

Closely work with the developers and stakeholders to ensure alignment on requirements.

Tracks and manages the requirements' status across the entire project lifecycle, including necessary enforcement or redefinition.

Write test scripts, execute and document Systems Integration Testing (SIT), log identified defects, and collaborate with developers to implement solutions.

Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT). 

Evaluate business processes, identify areas for improvement and develop and implement effective solutions based on process evaluations.

Assist/Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies, identify opportunities for process improvements and automation.

Develop and maintain process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to guide the project team. Effectively communicate complex information through simple, easily understandable visuals.

Conduct end-user training, process walkthroughs and reporting overviews.

Handle spot requests and assist with any other ad hoc duties assigned.

 



Qualifications/Skills:



Must have 2+ years of experience as IT Business Analyst

Excellent documentation skills, coupled with strong communication, presentation, and written abilities. Must also possess a strong team work spirit.

Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.  

Strong analytical, conceptual thinking, and problem-solving skills are essential. Must be meticulous and capable of clearly understanding, de-complicating, and proposing improvements to business requirements for project stakeholders.

Highly self-motivated, directed, can work independently with minimum assistance.

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.

Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and experience in Agile project delivery will be an advantage.

Proficiency in SQL scripting is a must.

Strong understanding and experience with Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes and Business Intelligence/Business Analytics (BI/BA) platforms is a plus.

 



System Requirements:



Processor should be 2 ghz and above, Intel core 5/7 or equal is highly required

MUST have the latest Operating System

      Windows 11 64bit

      Mac Ventura / Sonoma

16GB with 100GB Free disk space

MUST have a back-up Computer with the same specs as the main device

A Headset with noise cancelling feature is a must

20 mbps minimum wired connection for main isp

Back up internet is a must (pocket wifi, prepaid wifi etc. but strictly no USB Sticks allowed)

Back up power source

 



Shift Schedule: 8AM - 4PM Pacific Standard



Rate: depends on experience



MAGIC WORD: Yloper

title: Amazon International Marketplace Specialist
description:
******TO BE CONSIDERED AS AN APPLICANT, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR MOST UP-TO-DATE RESUME TAILORED TO THIS JOB POSTING!******



Amazon International Marketplace Specialist



Job Type: Full-Time 

Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM - 4:00 PM PST, with a 1-hour break

Salary: $



Job Overview: 

We are seeking an experienced Amazon International Marketplace Specialist to oversee and grow our presence across Amazon’s global marketplaces. This role requires hands-on experience managing Amazon Seller Central accounts, driving sales growth, and optimizing operations across multiple regions. The ideal candidate is analytical, detail-oriented, and has a proven track record of successfully navigating international e-commerce environments.



Key Responsibilities:

Manage day-to-day operations of Amazon accounts across international marketplaces (e.g., US, UK, Germany, Japan, Canada, etc.).

Develop and execute strategies to increase sales, improve conversion rates, and enhance product visibility internationally.

Optimize product listings for SEO, content, and localized messaging in different markets.

Monitor inventory levels, forecast demand, and coordinate with supply chain and fulfillment partners.

Analyze sales performance, customer reviews, and competitor activity to inform strategy.

Implement Amazon advertising campaigns (Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, etc.) to maximize ROI.

Ensure compliance with Amazon policies, international trade regulations, and local laws.

Collaborate with marketing, logistics, and product teams to execute promotions and launches.





Qualifications:

3-5 years of proven experience managing Amazon accounts in one or more international marketplaces.

Strong knowledge of Amazon Seller Central, Vendor Central, and related tools.

Demonstrated experience with Amazon SEO, advertising, and account optimization strategies.

Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.

Strong project management skills and attention to detail.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Experience with cross-border e-commerce, international shipping, and tax considerations is a plus.



Note: An NBI or police clearance will be required upon acceptance of the job offer.

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospective students



Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.

title: Project/Client Manager (Global Brands)
description:
Location: Remote



Schedule & Availability:

This role is remote with a mostly flexible schedule. However, availability during specific coordination windows is required due to our global clients and Korea-based production team.

	•	Client calls are typically scheduled during U.S. Eastern Time, most often between 9:00–11:00 AM EST, and from approximately 2:00 or 3:00 PM EST onward. Availability during these windows is required as needed.

	•	Regular coordination with our Korea-based team during their working hours (9:00 AM–6:00 PM KST) is required, particularly for time-sensitive or urgent matters. Earlier coordination within the KST day is preferred to ensure timely alignment and responses on both sides.

	•	Outside of scheduled calls, hours are flexible; however, responsiveness during weekdays is essential, and client and internal messages are expected to be handled in a timely manner.



About Us

We create and manufacture innovative skincare and cosmetic products for global brands across the U.S., EU, and Asia. From serums and sheet masks to hydrocolloid patches and microneedle innovations, we take ideas from concept to shelf.



About the Role

We are seeking a high-performing Product Development + Project Manager to join our growing team. You will manage client projects from initial concept through launch, ensuring smooth execution across formulation, packaging, regulatory, and production.



Compensation is competitive and includes performance-based bonuses.



What You’ll Do

	•	Serve as the main point of contact for clients and internal teams

	•	Manage all stages of product development, including briefing, sampling, revisions, testing, compliance, and approvals

	•	Maintain clear, accurate documentation across all phases of the product development process

	•	Track multiple projects with organized, up-to-date records

	•	Keep timelines tight and communication clear across multiple time zones

	•	Attend client meetings during required U.S. Eastern Time windows



Who You Are

	•	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven

	•	A strong communicator who is comfortable in client-facing roles

	•	Experienced in project management or sales; beauty, cosmetics, or CPG experience is a plus

	•	Comfortable managing several global projects simultaneously

	•	Proactive, responsive, and able to work effectively across time zones



How to Apply

This role reports directly to the owner and does *NOT involve sales or customer communication, unless explicitly instructed.



???? Responsibilities



* Execute daily internal operational tasks

* Manage and update Google Business Profile (GBP)

* Post photos and updates regularly

* Upload completed job media

* Keep profile active and up to date

* Post content to social media (2-3 Story post per day from provided media - 1 Reel *When Required 

* Maintain and update task boards in Notion

* Track inventory levels and report updates

* Document system improvements and process ideas

* Send daily progress updates via Slack

* Maintain organization across Notion and Google Drive

*Daily Team Meeting to stay on track 



???? What This Role Is NOT



* No sales outreach

* No responding to customer messages or reviews

* No pricing or booking decisions

  *(Unless explicitly instructed)*



???? Ideal Candidate



You are:



* Highly organized and detail-oriented

* Comfortable using Notion, Slack, Google Drive, and Social Media Management

* Familiar with Google Business Profile / Social Media 

* Able to work independently and follow systems

* Clear and consistent in written communication

* Reliable with daily execution

*Highly reliable Internet connection



???? Tools You’ll Use



* Notion (dashboards, tasks, SOPs)

* Slack (internal communication)

* Google Drive (media & resources)

* Google Business Profile

* Instagram (posting only)

*Meta Business Suite 



???? Work Schedule



* Part-time (hours negotiable)

* Daily check-ins required

* Long-term role with growth potential as the company scales



???? Compensation



Starting at $25 per day (based on experience - will increase 



???? How To Apply



Please include:



1. A brief introduction about yourself - Why you would be good at this position? 

2. Any experience with Notion, operations, or Google Business Profile

3. Your weekly availability



Apply directly through OnlineJobs.ph and include

 "Ops Manager Application” in your message.

title: Part-Time SEO Specialist
description:
We are a web design and development agency looking for a reliable, detail-oriented SEO specialist to manage ongoing SEO campaigns for a small portfolio of retained clients.



This is not a link-spamming or keyword-stuffing role. We focus on long-term, sustainable SEO built on:

- Clean, well-structured websites

- Strong UX and conversion intent

- High-quality, helpful content

- Clear, client-friendly reporting



You will work from a defined SEO process using established tools and monthly SOPs.



---------

Responsibilities

- Manage SEO campaigns for 5 retained clients per month

- Track keywords, rankings, and performance using SE Ranking

- Optimise existing pages 

- Perform monthly technical SEO checks

- Improve existing content and create limited new content where required

- Prepare clear, non-technical monthly reports that we can share with clients

- Follow a structured monthly SEO workflow

- Flag any SEO actions that may impact design, UX, or conversions



-----

Tools You Must Be Comfortable With

- Google Search Console

- Google Analytics (GA4)



Other tools we use that you can learn

- alli Ai

- diib



We are also happy for you to recommend tools you currently use



------

What We Are NOT Looking For:

- Automated backlink building

- Keyword stuffing

- “SEO hacks”

- Anyone who ignores brand voice, UX, or conversion outcomes



------

Experience Required

- Proven experience managing SEO for real businesses

- Ability to explain SEO results in plain English

- Strong written communication skills

- High attention to detail and process

- Agency experience is highly preferred



-----

Time Commitment

- Managing 4 clients

- Fully remote

- Available between 12 pm - 4pm Aus Times Monday - Friday



-----

What We Offer

- Fixed monthly pay of P40,000

- Ongoing, stable work for the right person

- Clear systems, SOPs, and expectations

- No micromanagement, just accountability and quality

- If this sounds like a good fit, apply with an overview of your SEO experience and the tools you have used.

- Please also include a recent report you have put together for a client.

title: Network Engineer
description:
We are a rapidly growing company setting a new standard in internet service delivery through our revolutionary, proprietary network. Our culture is built on integrity, accountability, hard work, collaboration, and social responsibility. We offer careers across multiple disciplines where talented professionals can grow and thrive.



We are currently hiring a Network Engineer to design, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot our large and continuously expanding wired and wireless network infrastructure.



Role Overview



The ideal candidate has a positive attitude, strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to work effectively with both customers and internal teams. This role requires solid hands-on experience in computer networking and the ability to support a fast-growing network environment.



Compensation



Hourly Rate: $10–$20 per hour, depending on experience and demonstrated skill set



After-hours and emergency support are compensated at a higher rate, in accordance with company policy



Responsibilities



Monitor network equipment and respond to alerts in a timely manner



Perform server maintenance, including software updates and virtual machine management



Troubleshoot network issues and conduct root cause analysis



Configure and maintain network equipment



Provide guidance and technical support to field technicians



Respond to and resolve customer trouble tickets



Research, test, and evaluate new networking equipment for integration into the MassiveMesh Network



Recommend, schedule, and implement network improvements, upgrades, and repairs



Perform network design and capacity planning



Required Qualifications



Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to individuals with varying levels of technical knowledge



Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills



A positive attitude and ability to work effectively in a team environment



Minimum of 3+ years of experience in the Information Technology field



Please apply only if you meet this experience requirement.



Preferred Qualifications



Network certifications such as Cisco CCNA or MikroTik MTCRE



Experience supporting large-scale wired and wireless network environments

title: Customer Service Associate VA
description:

s about shipping status, order tracking, and general questions.



Triage: Solving easy tickets quickly and escalating difficult ones to the Team Lead.

Shopify Experience: Preferred but not required.



Reliable: Stable internet connection and ability to follow SOPs strictly.

title: Creative Video Editor for E-commerce Ads | Full Time
description:
At Sole Assistant, we place VAs into stable, long-term roles with US-based ecommerce businesses. We have hired and placed more than 300 VAs in the last 3 years and currently support over 75 active roles. Our mission is to give talented Filipino VAs a real career pathway, not a short-term gig.

If you are coachable, fast, and eager to grow, this is the right opportunity for you.



Why Work With Sole Assistant:



• Stable full-time work with long-term clients

• Clear SOPs so you always know what to do

• Growth opportunities as you improve your skills

• 3-month employment guarantee (Average employment is 12+ months)

• We will replace you with another company if let go



We have a large network of businesses actively hiring, which allows us to place strong candidates quickly.



Rate: $5/hour | Around PHP46,000+ per month



About the Role:

We are a fast-growing eCommerce brand looking for a creative and detail-oriented Video/Content Editor to join our team long-term.



Your main role is to turn ad briefs into high-performing video ads using provided concepts, references, and creative assets. You’ll work closely with our Creative Directors and Copywriters to bring ideas to life through strong editing and storytelling.

This is not just a job- we are building an in-house team and want someone who is hungry to grow with us.



What You’ll Do

-Edit and produce eCommerce video ads

-Follow ad briefs, creative direction, and winning ad references

-Apply strong attention to detail in pacing, visuals, captions, and flow

-Study examples of winning ads and understand why they work

-Take a short onboarding quiz about winning ads and our target audience

-Collaborate with the creative team and follow SOPs



Required Experience (Must-Have)

At least 1 year experience in:

- Video editing

- Editing eCommerce / marketing ads

At least 1 year experience in using:

- CapCut

- Photoshop

Comfortable working in a team environment and following creative direction



Additional Preferred Skills (Big Advantage)

Experience with the following tools:

- HeyGen

- Higgsfield

- ElevenLabs

- Nano Banana

- Sora 2



Character Traits:

- Excruciatingly high level of attention to detail with all designs & edits

- Artistic & creative oriented mindset

- Visual communicator & storyteller

- High curiosity & an active imagination

- Strong willingness to do the ‘boring’ work required

- Great communicator with the team

- Time-efficient, but willing to spend extra time to do things right

- Coachable & desire to grow skill set & personal traits



How to Apply:

1. Fill out this Screening form:

2. Message us on OnlineJobs with this exact subject line: [Your Full Name] – [Your Favorite Shoe Brand]

3. At the end of your OnlineJobs message, answer this question in 3 to 5 sentences

-What do you think this job actually looks like day-to-day

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To: CEO

Work Hours: Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data — not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

• Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

• Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

• Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

• Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.



Regular Work Activities

• Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

• Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

• Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

• Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

• Reconcile inbound placement fees

• Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

• Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

• Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

• Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

• Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

• Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

• Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

• Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

• Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

• Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

• Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

• Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

• Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

• Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

• Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

• Advanced spreadsheet skills

• Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

• Strong analytical and investigative mindset

• High attention to detail

• Ability to reconcile complex datasets

• Process-driven

• Cost-reduction oriented thinking

• Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions – What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

• Direct report to the CEO

• Frequent communication with

• Operations Team

• Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education

• 2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

• Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

• Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

• Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

• E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

• Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

• Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

• Strong personal accountability

• Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-AGUZM8V3D/landing?u=
ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

s

Start part-time (10–20 hours per week).

Long-term position for the right person.

title: Revit Draftsman
description:
Click link to apply:

Are you looking for a long-term remote role where you can showcase your technical skills and be part of a growing design practice?

 

Join a rapidly expanding building design firm based in South Australia, delivering high-quality residential and commercial projects across the state. The company provides a working laptop, making it easier for you to perform at your best. If you take pride in producing accurate, detailed drawings and enjoy collaborating with a passionate, supportive team, this opportunity is perfect for you.

title: Inbound Sales & Dispatch Specialist
description:
Company: Staff Connect (on behalf of an Australian client)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Schedule: Rotating shifts between 5:00 PM – 9:00 AM AEDT

Employment Type: Full-Time

Salary: Competitive (based on skills and experience)

Leave: 1 week paid annual leave



About the Opportunity



Our client is Australia’s leading misfuelling response company, providing nationwide emergency assistance to drivers who a
 put the wrong fuel in their vehicle.



When customers call, they’re often stressed and stranded. Your role is to confidently guide them, secure the booking, and coordinate the technician response.



This is more than a dispatcher role — it’s a structured pathway toward leadership. High performers will gradually take on operational oversight and team responsibilities, with the goal of stepping into a Sales Manager / Team Leader position.



Staff Connect is helping build the client’s first offshore team in the Philippines — this is a ground-floor opportunity with real long-term growth.



The Role



You’ll begin in an Inbound Sales & Dispatch position, managing live calls and coordinating technicians across Australia.



As you prove your reliability, sales ability, and leadership potential, you’ll be given expanded responsibilities in operations, quality control, and team support.



Core Responsibilities

Inbound Sales & Job Coordination

- Answer incoming calls from motorists requiring urgent assistance

- Convert enquiries into confirmed bookings using empathy and confidence

- Coordinate nationwide technicians via scheduling platforms

- Secure deposits and accurately log all job details

- Manage cases from first contact through job completion

- Communicate via phone, Gmail, Slack, SMS, and booking systems



Operations & Quality Oversight

- Review previous day’s jobs for accuracy and completion

- Identify and correct unclosed or incorrectly logged jobs

- Ensure jobs are properly transferred to Xero and GeoOp



Monitor call logs for:

- Correct objection tagging

- Accurate ETAs and timestamps

- Proper discount logging

- Missed sales opportunities



- Assist in managing long fleet-related calls for PO numbers

- Track spill kit usage and upload relevant invoices in Xero (creation only)

- Act as a quality control layer to prevent operational errors



Process & Admin Support

- Update internal fleet documents using new templates

- Assist with SOP improvements and documentation updates

- Support onboarding and training initiatives as the team expands



Customer Escalation & Tech Coordination

- Manage escalated customer calls professionally

- Coordinate servo runs and tech card runs

- Participate in Slack huddles (camera-on when required)

- Be an active contributor during live team support sessions



Ideal Candidate

- At least 2 years’ experience in sales, dispatch, or call centre roles

- Strong track record of converting inbound enquiries

- Excellent English communication (written and spoken)

- Calm and composed under pressure

- Highly organised with strong attention to detail

- Confident using Google Workspace, Gmail, and Chrome

- Comfortable with Slack and video calls

- Reliable home setup with stable internet



Highly Regarded:

- Automotive or roadside assistance experience

- Knowledge of Australian geography

title: SEO Implementation Specialist (WordPress – B2B Manufacturing Sector)
description:
Summary

About Us



We are a specialized digital marketing agency dedicated to serving the manufacturing and B2B industrial sectors. We build high-performance websites and manage comprehensive marketing strategies for our clients. With a steady stream of new projects every month and a large base of long-term retainer clients, we are looking for a dedicated SEO partner to grow with us.



The Role

We are looking for an SEO Specialist who is not just a "task executor" but a proactive thinker. You will be responsible for the SEO health and growth of our clients' websites.



While we provide specific optimization briefs and requirements, we expect you to:



Deep Dive: Understand the client’s specific niche in the manufacturing industry.



Be Proactive: Analyze the project, identify gaps, and propose your own SEO strategies beyond our basic requirements.



Direct Execution: You must be comfortable working directly within WordPress (specifically using Bricks Builder) to implement changes.



Key Responsibilities

On-Page Optimization: Execute keyword placement, internal linking, and content structure adjustments.



Technical SEO: Implement Schema markup and ensure site health.



Collaboration: Work closely with our internal teams—including our writers, developers, and content creators—as well as the client’s own technical teams to ensure seamless execution.



WordPress Management: Directly modify pages and settings to meet SEO standards without needing constant developer intervention.



Requirements

Platform Expertise: Proven experience with WordPress and Bricks Builder is a must.



B2B/Industrial Experience: Familiarity with the manufacturing or industrial sector is a huge plus.



Analytical Mindset: Ability to read data, understand complex industrial products, and translate them into SEO opportunities.



Communication: Fluent English and the ability to work collaboratively with multiple internal and external departments.



Why Join Us?

Long-term Opportunity: We are looking for a partner, not a one-off freelancer. We prefer to start with a test project to ensure a good fit, leading to a stable, long-term collaboration.



Stable Workload: With a dedicated sales team and high client retention, we offer a consistent flow of work.



Supportive Environment: You will be backed by a full team of professionals to help you succeed.



How to Apply

Please provide:



A brief summary of your experience with WordPress and B2B SEO.



Examples of websites where you have successfully implemented SEO strategies.



Your thoughts on how SEO for a manufacturing company differs from standard B2C SEO.



Your preferred hourly rate or monthly retainer expectations.

title: Video Post-Production & Editing Specialist
description:
Hello!



We’re looking for a Video Post-Production & Editing Specialist to play a vital role in supporting our brand and marketing agency’s content efforts. This is an exciting opportunity to join a creative, high-standards team where your execution skills and creative judgment directly contribute to building demand and business 
ntum for founders, executives, and growing B2B brands.



In this role, you will work closely with the agency’s founder, a seasoned brand and marketing leader who values craft, strategic thinking, and long-term partnerships. You will not just “cut clips,” but help shape how ideas land in the world through well-edited, well-paced, and platform-optimized video content.



To apply, please read the full description and see the TO APPLY section at the end of this posting.



LOCATION: Remote (Preferably based in the Philippines)

JOB TYPE: Part-time contractor, approximately 15 hours per week, with the potential to increase over time as the client base grows. 



ROLE OVERVIEW

This role is focused on video post-production and editing across multiple client accounts. You will primarily take raw footage recorded in the U.S. by both professional film crews, and the executives themselves, and transform it into polished, compelling content for:



- Social Media (LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)

- Podcast episodes and other video assets

- PR, thought leadership, and executive visibility content



Our clients are primarily B2B companies, with occasional B2C brands or founder-led businesses. This is fast, platform-native, performance-driven editing — not slow, cinematic work. 



SCOPE OF WORK

- Video Editing & Post-Production

- Edit long-form and short-form video content from raw footage into polished, professional outputs.

- Create platform-native social clips optimized for LinkedIn, Instagram, and YouTube.

- Support podcast production through video edits, cut-downs, and visual consistency.

- Prepare video assets for PR, events, presentations, and thought-leadership use.

- Build strong hooks, pacing, retention, and clear CTAs appropriate to each platform.

- Create multiple versions of videos for testing when needed.

- Source stock footage, sound effects, and music when required.

- Deliver clean, organized exports on time and to spec.

- Use AI tools to speed up captions, cleanup, and enhancement workflows.

- This role prioritizes speed, clarity, and performance over cinematic or experimental editing.

- Content Judgment & Storytelling

- Identify strong 
nts, hooks, and sound bites worth clipping and amplifying.

- Understand brand positioning and messaging well enough to make smart editorial decisions.

- Translate long-form conversations into clear, engaging short-form content.





Collaboration

- Work closely with the founder and marketing strategists to align edits with content goals.

- Incorporate feedback efficiently while maintaining quality standards.

- Manage multiple projects and timelines with consistency and reliability.



REQUIREMENTS:

- 3+ years of professional video editing and post-production experience.

- Experience working with B2B brands, with exposure to B2C brands and/or influencers.

- Strong understanding of conversion-oriented, performance-driven editing for social platforms.

- Familiarity with performance metrics such as watch time, retention, CTR, and engagement.

- Strong understanding of conversion-oriented editing for social platforms.

- High attention to detail, consistency in delivering clean, on-spec exports, and pride in producing polished work.

- Strong written and verbal English communication skills, including the ability to collaborate clearly and efficiently in a remote environment.

- Ability to work independently and manage deadlines in a fully remote environment.

- Reliable computer capable of handling video editing software.

- Stable internet connection for file transfers and video calls.



NICE TO HAVES

- Experience with motion graphics or simple animations.

- Experience adding captions and formatting videos for social platforms.

- Familiarity with B2B SaaS, professional services, or founder-led brands.

- Experience editing content for influencers or personal brands.

- Comfort working from creative briefs rather than rigid instructions.



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

- Hourly contractor role

- Rate: $6-$8 USD per hour (depending on experience), paid bi-weekly

- 13th month guaranteed

- Paid birthday off

- Government dues are the responsibility of the contractor

- Remote Work: Enjoy the flexibility of working from anywhere.

- Flexible Hours: Work Monday - Friday, with 1-3 live check-in meetings every week to match EST (some weeks may require more or less depending on current projects, advanced notice will be provided for those weeks)

- Growth Opportunities: Potential for role expansion and additional responsibilities as the company grows.

- Small Team Environment: Work closely with a supportive and collaborative team where your contributions make a real impact.

- Holiday Flexibility: Option to adjust work schedules around local holidays and personal commitments.



TOOLS 

- Professional video editing tools (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve)

- Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets)

- Slack for team and client communication

- Project management tools such as Notion, 
 or Asana

- Google Meet for check-ins as needed



WORKING STYLE

- You should be comfortable working asynchronously, asking clarifying questions via
 and Slack, and delivering work you stand behind.



LONG-TERM MINDSET

- This is not a short-term or transactional role. We are looking for someone who wants to build a long-term working relationship, grow alongside the business, and take pride in being a trusted creative partner.



TO APPLY

If you meet the requirements and are excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you. Submit the following to 
 with the subject line “Video Editor – [Your Name]”:

- Your CV

- A link to your portfolio or multiple examples of video work (required)

- A cover letter answering the questions below: 

1. What is it about this role that appeals to you?

2. Describe your experience editing video for B2B and/or B2C brands.

3. Why do you think you'd be a great fit?

4. How do you approach identifying strong hooks or 
nts in long-form footage?

5. If selected, are you willing to complete a paid skills test project relevant to this role?



Please note, we will not proceed with applicants that have not answered the questions.



Please use a minimum of 3 apply points. 



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Social Media Marketing (SMM) Specialist – Long-Term, Personal Brand Focus
description:
START BEFORE THE END OF THIS WEEK (job posted Feb 11, 2026)



Hey! I’m Draye.

I’ve been in the digital marketing industry for almost 2 decades, and I’ve worked with some big names you’d probably recognize—think Shark Tank sharks, top bestselling authors, and brands/entrepreneurs who take marketing seriously.

Now I’m looking for a solid, experienced SMM Specialist who can help me build my personal brand across multiple platforms—consistently, creatively, and with strategy (not random posting).

This is for someone who wants a long-term home and can focus on ONE main project (this one).



The Main Focus (First 3–6 Months)

For the first 3 to 6 months, your focus is 100% on MY PERSONAL BRAND across all platforms.

Once we’ve built a strong content engine, you may also start supporting my business pages (Redfern Media + Fractional CMO), but personal brand comes first.



Who This Is For

You’re a great fit if:

You have 3+ years experience as an SMM Specialist

You’ve worked in a digital marketing agency (required)

You can handle strategy + execution (not just posting)

You’re creative and can make content that doesn’t look “VA generic”

You’re confident editing videos for Reels, TikTok, Shorts, LinkedIn video, and YouTube

You know how to read analytics and actually improve performance



What You’ll Be Doing

1) Content Strategy + Planning

Build content pillars + weekly/monthly posting plan

Turn ideas into scroll-stopping posts

Repurpose content across platforms without it looking copy/paste

2) Posting + Engagement (Multi-Platform)

You’ll post and engage across:

Meta 
 + Instagram)

LinkedIn

YouTube

Google Business Profile

Other platforms as needed

Daily engagement includes comments, DMs, replies, community-building.

3) Creative Production (Design + Video)

• Design graphics/carousels (Canva + Adobe preferred)

• Video editing:

Short-form: Reels / TikTok / Shorts / LinkedIn video

Long-form: YouTube videos (basic clean edits, captions, pacing, etc.)

• Make content look premium and on-brand

4) Analytics + Reporting

• Weekly check-ins on performance

• Monthly report with:

What worked / what didn’t

Growth + engagement trends

Clear recommendations for next month



Important: This is NOT a “many clients” role

I’m looking for someone who can lock in on this project long-term and treat it like a real brand, not a side task.

If you’re juggling 3–5 clients already, this probably won’t work.



How to Apply

Apply here: 
/careers

Quick heads up—we shortlist fast. Just follow the simple instructions on the application page (it’s intentional). The people who follow directions usually end up being the best fit, and it helps us move you to the top ASAP.



If you’re the kind of person who can take ownership, create great content, and stay consistent long-term… I’m genuinely excited to start working with you.



Note: You’ll be working closely with me and my Chief of Staff who’s been with me for 6 years. This role isn’t just “do what you like” — you’ll also learn how we operate from people who are strong in leadership, process management, and marketing, and you’ll level up fast if you’re coachable.



Draye Redfern

title: Virtual Customer Service Representative
description:
Remote Customer Service Representative (Contractor) for Best Delegate | Model United Nations Institute

Must overlap with U.S. business hours for at least 4 hours/day

Anticipated hours are 30-40 hours per week at a pay of $7 US Dollars per hour.  



About Best Delegate



Best Delegate is a global education company dedicated to empowering youth through leadership development and Global Citizenship Education, aligned with the United Nations’ vision for a more informed and engaged world. We believe Model United Nations is the single best activity for preparing future world leaders.



Founded in 2010 by lifelong MUNers Ryan Villanueva and Kevin Felix Chan — two of the world’s leading experts in Model UN — Best Delegate has grown from a passion project into a global movement. Nearly 15 years later, we are a fast growing organization with big goals. Under the leadership of CEO Laurabeth Goldsmith, our team now includes 8 full time staff and 50+ part time tea
mbers who deliver high impact programs to students around the world.



Our work spans summer programs, workshops, MUN Clubs, digital resources, and leadership training. We’ve expanded beyond Model UN to teach students directly about global leadership, helping them build the confidence, communication skills, and sense of purpose needed to become changemakers in their communities. Whether a student is inspired by public policy, international affairs, or any career path that uplifts others, we aim to help them see a future where they can lead.



Our websites attract over 2 million visitors annually, and our mission is simple: make Model UN and global leadership education accessible to any student or teacher who wants to experience this life changing activity.



Company Core Values



All Best Delegate tea
mbers are expected to embody the company’s core values. These values guide our culture, and define what great leadership looks like. 



Bring Out the Best: Approach people and challenges with positivity and a growth mindset.

Passion for Mentorship: Actively help others grow personally and professionally.

Open to Feedback: Listen with the intent to learn, reflect, and take action.

High Performer: Consistently take full ownership of responsibilities and deliver excellent results.

Strategic: Understand the bigger picture and solve meaningful challenges. 

Professional: Serve as a reliable, responsible, and positive representative of Best Delegate.



Role Summary (WHAT)



The Customer Service Representative ensures that every family, student, teacher, and partner who contacts Best Delegate receives a friendly, timely, and professional response. This contractor manages high volume communication across
, phone, and CRM systems, supports sales operations, and keeps our data and calendars organized so the entire team can operate smoothly.



This is a high responsibility, high communication role ideal for someone who loves helping people, thrives in organized systems, and enjoys working behind the scenes to keep a mission driven organization running.



This role reports directly to Toni Lawrence, Senior Marketing and Sales Manager.



Key Responsibilities (WHAT You Will Do)

Customer Support & Communication

Respond to all
 inquiries within 24 business hours (ideally sooner) using HubSpot. Answer incoming phone calls and return missed calls using RingCentral within 24 hours (at times that work for US based parents in all USA timezones).

Communicate with families in a warm, professional, and solutions oriented manner.

Send personalized
 sequences to ~500 contacts/day using HubSpot templates.

Follow up with clients and collect testimonials.



CRM & Data Management:

Maintain and clean HubSpot CRM to ensure all contacts are accurate, complete, and valuable marketing leads.

Tag, segment, and update contact records as needed.

Export and organize sales data from Shopify.

Keep weekly sales data updated in our internal scorecard.



Operations & Administrative Support

Maintain the company calendar and ensure all projects stay on schedule.

Support the Programs and Operations teams with administrative tasks as needed.

Collaborate with the team via Slack and Google Workspace.

Learn the basics of Model UN and the MUN Institute programs to confidently answer parent questions.



How You Will Work (HOW) 

Professional Communication

Warm, clear, and friendly tone in all interactions.

Confident and polished phone presence.

Ability to personalize messages while staying on brand.

Operational Excellence

Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

Comfortable managing large volumes of
 and data.

Consistent follow through and reliable task completion.

Tech Forward Mindset

Quick learner with new tools and systems.

Comfortable navigating CRMs, spreadsheets, and communication platforms.

Able to troubleshoot small issues independently.

Team Collaboration

Communicates proactively with supervisors.

Works well asynchronously across time zones.

Open to feedback and continuous improvement.



Expected Outcomes (RESULTS)

Success in this role looks like:

100% of
s answered within 24 business hours

Accurate, clean, and well maintained HubSpot CRM

Weekly sales data delivered on time and error free

High quality, personalized
 sequences sent daily

Positive feedback from families about their customer service experience

A well organized company calendar with projects running on schedule



Required Qualifications

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Professional phone presence

Experience with customer service or administrative support

Strong organizational and time management skills

Ability to work independently and handle high volume tasks

Comfort with technology and learning new systems

Ability to overlap with U.S. business hours for at least 4+ hours/day



Preferred Qualifications

Experience with HubSpot CRM

Experience with Shopify

Experience with RingCentral or similar phone systems

Familiarity with Model UN or willingness to learn

Experience in education, youth programs, or parent facing roles



How to Apply

Please submit the following:

Your résumé

A 1-2 minute video 

Format: A simple phone or laptop recording is perfect

Setting: Quiet, well lit space

No editing or special effects needed — we’re looking for clarity and authenticity



What to include in the video: 

Introduce yourself and share a little about your background.

Explain why you’re interested in the Customer Service Representative role at Best Delegate.

Describe a time you helped a customer or solved a problem through communication.

Share what makes you a strong fit for a high volume, parent facing US based customer service position.

Please upload your video to a private or unlisted link (YouTube, Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.) and include the link in your
 

Your weekly availability, including your overlap with U.S. business hours

Two professional references (name, relationship,
, phone)



Send your application to: 

Subject line: Customer Service Representative – Your Name

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

title: Experienced Editorial Outreach Specialist
description:
Now Hiring: Experienced Editorial Outreach Specialist

Remote Position | Long-Term Opportunity

Are you an experienced, detail-oriented writer with a strong commitment to producing measurable media results? Are you seeking a stable remote role with long-term growth potential—one that rewards high-quality, publication-ready content and the ability to build strong journalist relationships?

SimplyMedia is seeking a highly skilled Remote Editorial Outreach Specialist to join our expanding team. We are looking for a professional who understands editorial standards and can consistently deliver fast, compelling, and quotable pitches in response to media queries (HARO, Featured, etc.) while cultivating positive journalist relationships.

A writing background and portfolio/sample submissions are required.



What You’ll Receive

* Starting Pay: $450 per month

* Performance Bonuses: Top-performing specialists can advance from $450 to up to $1,000 per month in under six months by meeting our quality and speed KPIs (details provided upon hire).

* Paid Holidays (Philippine Official Holidays) & Paid Time Off: Available after regularization based on consistent, excellent performance.

* Targeted Training Provided: We will train you in our outreach tools and strategies; you must bring the foundational writing ability.

* Annual Bonuses for high-performing tea
mbers.



Who We’re Looking For

* Non-Negotiable: Proven writing experience (1+ years preferred) with the ability to submit a portfolio or relevant writing samples (e.g., media pitches, articles, marketing copy).

* Exceptional Writing Ability: Superb command of written English, strong grammar, and excellent editorial judgment. All outputs must be publication-ready.

* Relationship-Oriented Professional: Experience communicating politely and professionally, with the ability to build long-term rapport with journalists.

* Strategic Thinker: Understanding of media relations, PR strategy, or SEO link building is a significant advantage. You should know how to pitch a compelling angle—not just promote a company.

* Fast, Focused, and Reliable: Ability to respond quickly and deliver high-quality content under tight deadlines (e.g., targeting submission within the first 50 responses).



Key Responsibilities

As a Remote Editorial Outreach Specialist, your primary focus will be generating media coverage through expert communication and strong relationship management:

* Craft Quotable Pitches: Write clear, concise, expert-level responses with strong soundbites and quotable insights reporters can use immediately.

* Strategic Outreach & Follow-Up: Manage query platforms (HARO, Featured, etc.), ensuring fast submissions and timely, professional follow-ups to build journalist relationships.

* Communication Management: Organize, research, and respond to media correspondence with clarity, professionalism, and a focus on maintaining positive rapport.

This is a long-term, fully remote position focused on content quality, measurable media outcomes, and professional relationship building.?Regularization to permanent status is based on consistently excellent performance.



If You’re a Dependable, Skilled Writer Who Thrives Under Pressure—We Want to Hear from You

Multiple positions available. Apply now:

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

s

title: Remote Operations & Executive Assistant (Gym Systems & Membership Admin)
description:
We operate a premium boxing and fitness facility based in NSW, Australia. Our business includes multiple membership divisions, events, and operational systems that require structure, accuracy and consistency.



We are looking for a long-term Remote Operations & Executive Assistant to support our membership systems, reporting, backend administration and occasional executive coordination tasks.



This is not a basic data-entry role. We are looking for someone detail-driven, organised and reliable, who wants to grow with a business long-term.



Work Schedule:

• 30 hours per week (initially)

• Monday–Friday

• 9:00am–3:00pm Philippines time

• Minor adjustments may occur depending on operational needs



After a 4–8 week initial period, strong performance may lead to a full-time role (38–40 hours per week) with expanded responsibilities and growth opportunities.



Responsibilities

Membership & Billing Management-

• Generate daily reports from Debit Success (membership billing platform)

• Reconcile all updates with GymMaster (membership & access control system)

• Track new memberships, cancellations, suspensions and overdue accounts

• Categorise members correctly across various membership types

• Maintain accurate records across systems



Accuracy is critical. Attention to detail is non-negotiable as this is a major area of our business.



Access Control & Overdue Management-

• Suspend swipe access for overdue members

• Reinstate access when payments are resolved

• Conduct weekly audits to ensure compliance

• Identify and report discrepancies



Member Communication-

• Send overdue payment reminders

• Respond to general membership enquiries

• Send event
s (ticket releases, updates, announcements)

• Escalate complex matters when required



Strong written English is essential.



Event & Backend Support- 

• Maintain spreadsheets

• Assist with event ticket coordination

• Support backend administrative processes



Executive & Operational Support (As Needed)-

Occasionally, you will assist with:

• Calendar organisation and scheduling

• Coordinating with on-floor staff regarding bookings and maintenance schedules

• Researching and summarising travel options (flights, accommodation, transport)

• Preparing visa application information

• Tracking upcoming bills and preparing simple revenue summaries

• Budget tracking support

• Organising reminders for servicing and business-related logistics

These tasks support business operations and will not replace core responsibilities.



Requirements:

We are looking for someone who:



• Is highly organised and detail-oriented

• Is comfortable working with reports and spreadsheets

• Has strong written English

• Is dependable, proactive and professional

• Can handle sensitive financial and member data responsibly



Experience with Debit Success, GymMaster, or similar CRM/billing systems is highly preferred.



We value communication, reliability and long-term commitment. We are looking for someone who wants to grow with a business — not just complete tasks.





Compensation

• $5.50 USD per hour (with room for increase based on performance)

• 30 hours per week initially

• Opportunity to increase to 38–40 hours per week after successful initial period

• Semi-monthly payroll aligned with Philippine standards

• Paid leave in accordance with Philippine labour standards

• Performance-based bonus paid every 6 months, based on reliability, accuracy and contribution



We reward consistency and high performance.



IMPORTANT – Application Instructions:

To confirm you have read this entire job description carefully:

The secret word for this application is: LEGACYSTRONG



You must include the word LEGACYSTRONG in the SUBJECT LINE of your application.

Applications without this exact word in the subject line will not be reviewed.





How to Apply:

Please include the following in your application:



- A short introduction about yourself and your previous remote work experience.

- Your experience with Debit Success, GymMaster, or similar billing/CRM systems (please be specific).

- Your previous experience communicating with members or clients, including examples of handling enquiries or payment-related situations.

- Your weekly availability (confirm you can work 9:00am–3:00pm Philippines time).

- Confirmation that you are comfortable with the pay structure and growth pathway outlined above.

- Secret word in Subject Line

title: Client Services Coordinator (Admissions & Finance) – Virtual
description:
Job Overview



The Program Intake Coordinator / Client Services Coordinator manages the front end of the client journey, including intake interviews, referral partner communication, onboarding coordination, and resident payment follow-up. This role is critical to keeping beds filled, maintaining financial accountability, and ensuring a smooth, professional intake experience for every resident. This is a virtual position and requires strong English communication skills, comfort with technology, attention to detail, and the ability to handle sensitive conversations with professionalism and empathy.



Responsibilities



• Respond to inquiries from prospective residents and referral partners

• Conduct intake interviews with prospective residents using provided scripts

• Screen applicants and identify disqualifying factors based on program criteria

• Gather, verify, and organize required intake documentation

• Explain program expectations, fees, and policies clearly and professionally

• Coordinate intake timelines and move-in dates with leadership and program staff

• Send onboarding forms and orientation details

• Ensure a smooth, efficient intake process from first contact to move-in

• Follow SOPs exactly and document all steps in the system

• Communicate professionally with referral partners (treatment centers, case managers, courts, etc.)

• Provide updates on application status and bed availability

• Maintain timely follow-up to avoid delays or missed placements

• Track resident balances, payment schedules, and due dates

• Set up and accurately calculate payment plans

• Send friendly but firm payment reminders

• Document client communication regarding late or missed payments

• Escalate financial or eligibility issues to management when appropriate

• Help minimize vacancies by resolving financial barriers quickly and appropriately

• Maintain accurate digital records

• Provide weekly updates to leadership



Requirements



• Excellent written and spoken English

• Professional phone and video call presence

• Comfortable with technology (CRM systems, spreadsheets,
, scheduling tools)

• Strong organizational and data-entry skills

• Basic math skills (calculating balances, payment plans, totals)

• Ability to follow SOPs and structured procedures consistently and accurately

• Professional, calm, and respectful communication style

• Comfortable discussing sensitive topics such as substance use history, mental health challenges, and financial issues

• Ability to identify potential disqualifying items and flag concerns

• Able to be firm but tactful when discussing payments and policies

• Understands urgency around filling beds and avoiding unnecessary vacancies

• Reliable computer, headset, and internet connection



Preferred but Not Required



• Experience as a Virtual Assistant

• Background in customer service, healthcare, or billing

• Experience working with intake, admissions, or client coordination roles



Training Provided



• Intake scripts

• Step-by-step procedures and SOPs

• Program overview and expectations

• Ongoing support and guidance



Why Join Lantern Residences



• Long-term, stable remote role

• Clear expectations, systems, and training

• Opportunity for growth within the organization

• Meaningful, mission-driven work that makes a real impact



Compensation

This is a full-time, remote position (40 hours per week).



Training / Probation Period (First 30 Days):

• $4.00 per hour during training and onboarding

• This period is used to evaluate reliability, communication, accuracy, and ability to follow SOPs



Post-Training Rate (After Successful Completion):

• $5.50 – $6.50 per hour based on performance, accuracy, and independence

• Pay increase is tied to SOP mastery, quality of work, and consistency



Growth & Performance Increases:

• High-performing tea
mbers are eligible for future raises based on results, reliability, and added responsibility
