title: Virtual Executive Assistant — Executive Life & Business Support (Long-Term)
description:
# Virtual Executive Assistant — Executive Life & Business Support (Hospitality Focus)



## About the Role (Please Read Carefully)  



I am a California-based entrepreneur who operates multiple businesses, primarily in the restaurant and hospitality space (restaurants, bars, events, and related projects). My schedule, inbox, and priorities move quickly, and I rely on strong systems, clear communication, and disciplined follow-through.



I am looking for an experienced Virtual Executive Assistant (EA) who can independently manage the core of my executive life — including inbox, calendar, priorities, and follow-ups — while also being comfortable taking on occasional, clearly scoped business-related tasks tied to my hospitality businesses.



This is a long-term role for a high-performing Executive Assistant, not an entry-level VA position. If you require basic training in
, calendar, or task management, this is not the right fit.



---



## What This Role Is (and Isn’t)  



This role IS:  

- Executive-life focused (inbox, calendar, priorities, follow-ups)  

- Systematic, structured, and outcome-driven  

- Best suited for someone who can operate with minimal direction  

- Ideal for someone who understands the pace and urgency of hospitality  



This role is NOT:  

- A general, unfocused “do everything” VA role  

- Customer service, social media management, or cold calling  

- A beginner or junior admin position  



---



## Who You Are (Must-Haves)  



Please only apply if you genuinely meet most of these criteria:



You have:  

- At least 3+ years of real Executive Assistant or Senior VA experience  

- Strong written and spoken English (professional, clear, confident)  

- Proven experience managing:  

  - Busy executive inboxes  

  - Complex calendars across multiple time zones  

  - Follow-ups with vendors, partners, and internal teams  

  - Task tracking and prioritization systems  



You are:  

- Extremely detail-oriented and reliable  

- Proactive (you anticipate needs instead of waiting for instructions)  

- Comfortable working with a fast-paced business owner  

- Trustworthy with confidential information  

- Equipped with stable internet, a quiet workspace, and professional setup  



Preferred (Nice to Have):  

- Prior experience supporting someone in restaurants, hospitality, or events  

- Familiarity with:  

  - Google Workspace (Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Docs, Sheets)  

  - Notion, Asana, Trello, or similar tools  

  - Slack or similar messaging platforms  



---



## Your Core Responsibilities (Primary Focus)  



### 1) Inbox & Communication Management (Top Priority)  

- Daily inbox triage and organization  

- Clearly flag urgent items  

- Draft responses when appropriate (using provided templates/examples)  

- Keep
 threads moving forward and reduce my overall
 load  



### 2) Calendar & Scheduling  

- Manage my calendar efficiently  

- Schedule meetings, calls, vendor visits, tastings, and appointments  

- Confirm details, send reminders, and prevent conflicts  

- Maintain a clear weekly overview so I am never surprised  



### 3) Follow-Ups & “Waiting On” Tracker  

- Maintain a simple, clean tracker of outstanding items  

- Follow up with vendors, partners, contractors, or internal tea
mbers as needed  

- Ensure nothing falls through the cracks  



### 4) Executive Support & Light Project Coordination (Hospitality Context)  



From time to time, you may be asked to help with clearly defined, short-term business tasks such as:  

- Reviewing whether certain action items are being completed by tea
mbers  

- Spot-checking or monitoring specific processes for a set period (e.g., “for the next two weeks, verify clock-ins are being done properly”)  

- Organizing information and summarizing it back to me in a clear, concise way  

- Light research (e.g., comparing options, gathering info, or compiling quotes)  



These requests will always be clear, scoped, and time-bound, not vague or open-ended.



### 5) Document & Admin Support  

- Format and polish internal documents, SOPs, menus, or proposals  

- Create clean checklists or simple trackers when needed  

- Keep files organized in Google Drive  



---



## What Success Looks Like (First 2–3 Weeks)  



Within your first few weeks, I expect:  

- My inbox is significantly more manageable  

- My calendar runs smoothly with fewer last-minute issues  

- Follow-ups are consistent and well-documented  

- You communicate clearly and ask smart clarifying questions  

- You can execute tasks independently once briefed  



---



## Hours & Pay  

- Pay: Up to $10 USD per hour, based on experience and performance  

- Hours: 20–30 hours per week to start, with potential to increase  

- Required overlap: At least 2–4 hours per weekday with Pacific Time (California)  

- This is a long-term position for the right person.  



---



## How to Apply (You MUST Follow These Steps)  



To be considered, you must submit all of the following:



### 1) A 2–3 minute Loom or video introduction covering:  

- Your background as an Executive Assistant  

- The types of executives you have supported  

- Your experience (if any) working with restaurants, hospitality, or fast-paced environments  

- Why you believe you are a strong fit for this role  



### 2) Short written answers to these questions:  

- How do you typically triage and manage a busy inbox?  

- How do you track follow-ups so nothing gets missed?  

- What tools are you most comfortable using and why?  



### 3) One example (you may redact private info):  

- A tracker, calendar system, or organized document you have created  



### Attention to Detail Test:  

Begin your application with:  

???? “Executive EA — I read the full post.”  



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered.



---



## Hiring Process  

- Short interview  

- Small paid test task  

- 2-week trial period before final confirmation  



I look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Virtual Assistant – Content, Website & Digital Support (Remote, Flexible)
description:
About the Business

I run a thoughtful, strategy-driven digital business focused on content, websites, and systems that provide consistent leads for my clients. This is not a corporate environment or a high-volume task factory. The work is intentional, structured, and detail-oriented.



I value independence, clear communication, and people who take pride in completing work thoroughly. If you enjoy clean execution, problem-solving, and checking things off because they are truly finished, this role will be a strong fit.



Role Summary

This role focuses on execution support for content, data organization, and website-related tasks. You will be given clear instructions and are expected to complete tasks independently, think through missing information, and ensure work is fully complete before marking tasks done.



This is an outcome-focused role, not a micromanaged one.



Who This Role Is For

This role is best suited for someone who is:

• Detail-oriented and accurate

• A self-starter who completes tasks without constant oversight

• A proactive problem solver who fills in gaps instead of leaving tasks incomplete

• Comfortable asking clarifying questions when genuinely needed

• Respectful of deadlines and urgency

If this has you nodding your head yes, keep reading!



Key Responsibilities

You will regularly be responsible for:

1. Creating and scheduling content using provided templates, prompts, or AI tools

2. Creating simple social media graphics using existing Canva templates

3. Scheduling social media posts once content is approved

4. Copying, formatting, and scheduling blog posts accurately

5. Researching, organizing, and updating data with attention to detail



Required Technical Skills

To succeed in this role, you should be comfortable with:

1. Canva (template-based design only)

2. WordPress (basic content updates and formatting, following instructions)

3. Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

4. ChatGPT or similar AI tools for content support

5. Social media scheduling tools



Additional Expectations (Important)

This role requires someone who can:

• Follow instructions while thinking independently

• Manage time reliably and communicate clearly

• Be transparent about availability and timelines

• Research missing information to complete tasks properly

• Accept feedback and improve quickly

If you require constant step-by-step guidance or struggle to finish tasks fully, this role will not be a good fit.



Work Style & Support

• You will receive clear written instructions and short video walkthroughs when needed

• I am available for clarification questions, but expect problem-solving before escalation

• No fixed working hours are required, as long as tasks are completed accurately and on time



Compensation

Compensation is competitive and based on experience, typically structured as an hourly rate with room-to-grow as the role expands. Exact details will be discussed during the interview.



How to Apply

To apply, please submit:

1. A short introduction video explaining why this role caught your attention. You can use loom or another video recording program.

2. A brief overview of your relevant experience with content, organization, or website work

3. Your answer to the following question: What type of work makes you feel most “in the zone”?

Applications that do not answer this question will not be considered.



Final Note

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys structured work, takes ownership of outcomes, and values doing things right the first time. If that sounds like you, I’d love to hear from you.

title: Google Ads Specialist (Shopify + GA4) — WFO
description:
(a) About the role



We run two established pet businesses (e-commerce + veterinary clinic) with a deep base of warm customers. We are hiring a Google specialist to own our Google Ads + measurement stack end-to-end.



We are already spending on Google. Your first mission is to audit and fix our setup quickly, so we stop waste and can trust our tracking.



(b) What you will own



Google Ads (across all inventories)

- Manage and optimize campaigns across Search / Shopping / Performance Max / Display / YouTube

- Set clear campaign goals (sales/conversions) and control budget allocation

- Build and maintain clean account structure, audiences, and exclusions

- Improve efficiency and incrementality (not vanity reach)



Measurement (critical)

- Set up or fix GA4 for Shopify (and GTM if needed)

- Ensure conversion tracking is correct (no duplicates/wrong conversions)

- Enforce UTM discipline + build a simple weekly dashboard

- Document the setup so it stays clean long-term

- Audit our current campaigns and recommend what to pause/keep (fast)

- Improve account structure and spend efficiency

- Manage remarketing and any existing campaign types we are running (we will align on scope)



GA4 / Tracking / Measurement (critical)

- Set up or fix GA4 for Shopify (and GTM if needed)

- Ensure conversion tracking is correct and validated (no duplicate / wrong conversions)

- Enforce UTM discipline and build a simple weekly performance dashboard

- Document the setup so it stays clean over time



Our operating principles 

- We prioritize measurable ROI and scale only when tracking is clean

- We do not want uncontrolled broad spend

- Any expansion into new inventories is based on a clear test plan and results



(c) Requirements

- Strong Google Ads experience across multiple inventories (not just one)

- Proven GA4 setup experience for Shopify (from scratch or fixing broken setups)



Clear communicator, organized, fast execution



Bonus: Merchant Center + product feed optimization experience



(d) Please apply but submitting your CV and relevant work experience.
